         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING HENRY, the Fourth. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">HENRY, Prince of Wales</span>
                        <span class="personname">JOHN of Lancaster</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">sons of the King</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">WESTMORELAND</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR WALTER BLUNT</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">THOMAS PERCY, Earl of Worcester. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HENRY PERCY, Earl of Northumberland. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HENRY PERCY, surnamed HOTSPUR, his son. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EDMUND MORTIMER, Earl of March. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">RICHARD SCROOP, Archbishop of York. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ARCHIBALD, Earl of Douglas. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">OWEN GLENDOWER</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR RICHARD VERNON</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR JOHN FALSTAFF</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR MICHAEL, a friend to the Archbishop of York.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">POINS</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">GADSHILL</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PETO</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BARDOLPH</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FRANCIS, a waiter.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY PERCY, wife to Hotspur, and sister to Mortimer.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY MORTIMER, daughter to Glendower, and wife to Mortimer.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MISTRESS QUICKLY, hostess of a tavern in Eastcheap. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Officers, Sheriff, Vintner, Chamberlain, Drawers, two Carriers, Travellers, Attendants, and an Ostler.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  England.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  London. An apartment of the Prince's.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, the EARL
of WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">So shaken as we are, so wan with care,</div>
                     <div class="line">Find we a time for frighted peace to pant,</div>
                     <div class="line">And breathe short-winded accents of new broils</div>
                     <div class="line">To be commenced in strands afar remote.</div>
                     <div class="line">No more the thirsty entrance of this soil</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall daub her lips with her own children's blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor more shall trenching war channel her fields,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor bruise her flowerets with the armed hoofs</div>
                     <div class="line">Of hostile paces: those opposed eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, like the meteors of a troubled heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">All of one nature, of one substance bred,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did lately meet in the intestine shock</div>
                     <div class="line">And furious close of civil butchery</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall now, in mutual well-beseeming ranks,</div>
                     <div class="line">March all one way and be no more opposed</div>
                     <div class="line">Against acquaintance, kindred and allies:</div>
                     <div class="line">The edge of war, like an ill-sheathed knife,</div>
                     <div class="line">No more shall cut his master. Therefore, friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">As far as to the sepulchre of Christ,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose soldier now, under whose blessed cross</div>
                     <div class="line">We are impressed and engaged to fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forthwith a power of English shall we levy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose arms were moulded in their mothers' womb</div>
                     <div class="line">To chase these pagans in those holy fields</div>
                     <div class="line">Over whose acres walk'd those blessed feet</div>
                     <div class="line">Which fourteen hundred years ago were nail'd</div>
                     <div class="line">For our advantage on the bitter cross.</div>
                     <div class="line">But this our purpose now is twelve month old,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bootless 'tis to tell you we will go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore we meet not now. Then let me hear</div>
                     <div class="line">Of you, my gentle cousin Westmoreland,</div>
                     <div class="line">What yesternight our council did decree</div>
                     <div class="line">In forwarding this dear expedience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, this haste was hot in question,</div>
                     <div class="line">And many limits of the charge set down</div>
                     <div class="line">But yesternight: when all athwart there came</div>
                     <div class="line">A post from Wales loaden with heavy news;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose worst was, that the noble Mortimer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leading the men of Herefordshire to fight</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the irregular and wild Glendower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was by the rude hands of that Welshman taken,</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand of his people butchered;</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon whose dead corpse there was such misuse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such beastly shameless transformation,</div>
                     <div class="line">By those Welshwomen done as may not be</div>
                     <div class="line">Without much shame retold or spoken of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">It seems then that the tidings of this broil</div>
                     <div class="line">Brake off our business for the Holy Land.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">This match'd with other did, my gracious lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">For more uneven and unwelcome news</div>
                     <div class="line">Came from the north and thus it did import:</div>
                     <div class="line">On Holy-rood day, the gallant Hotspur there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Harry Percy and brave Archibald,</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever-valiant and approved Scot,</div>
                     <div class="line">At Holmedon met,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where they did spend a sad and bloody hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">As by discharge of their artillery,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shape of likelihood, the news was told;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he that brought them, in the very heat</div>
                     <div class="line">And pride of their contention did take horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncertain of the issue any way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a dear, a true industrious friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Walter Blunt, new lighted from his horse.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stain'd with the variation of each soil</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt that Holmedon and this seat of ours;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he hath brought us smooth and welcome news.</div>
                     <div class="line">The Earl of Douglas is discomfited:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ten thousand bold Scots, two and twenty knights,</div>
                     <div class="line">Balk'd in their own blood did Sir Walter see</div>
                     <div class="line">On Holmedon's plains. Of prisoners, Hotspur took</div>
                     <div class="line">Mordake the Earl of Fife, and eldest son</div>
                     <div class="line">To beaten Douglas; and the Earl of Athol,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Murray, Angus, and Menteith:</div>
                     <div class="line">And is not this an honourable spoil?</div>
                     <div class="line">A gallant prize? ha, cousin, is it not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a conquest for a prince to boast of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, there thou makest me sad and makest me sin</div>
                     <div class="line">In envy that my Lord Northumberland</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be the father to so blest a son,</div>
                     <div class="line">A son who is the theme of honour's tongue;</div>
                     <div class="line">Amongst a grove, the very straightest plant;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is sweet Fortune's minion and her pride:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst I, by looking on the praise of him,</div>
                     <div class="line">See riot and dishonour stain the brow</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my young Harry. O that it could be proved</div>
                     <div class="line">That some night-tripping fairy had exchanged</div>
                     <div class="line">In cradle-clothes our children where they lay,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call'd mine Percy, his Plantagenet!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then would I have his Harry, and he mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">But let him from my thoughts. What think you, coz,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this young Percy's pride? the prisoners,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he in this adventure hath surprised,</div>
                     <div class="line">To his own use he keeps; and sends me word,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall have none but Mordake Earl of Fife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">This is his uncle's teaching; this is Worcester,</div>
                     <div class="line">Malevolent to you in all aspects;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes him prune himself, and bristle up</div>
                     <div class="line">The crest of youth against your dignity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">But I have sent for him to answer this;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for this cause awhile we must neglect</div>
                     <div class="line">Our holy purpose to Jerusalem.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, on Wednesday next our council we</div>
                     <div class="line">Will hold at Windsor; so inform the lords:</div>
                     <div class="line">But come yourself with speed to us again;</div>
                     <div class="line">For more is to be said and to be done</div>
                     <div class="line">Than out of anger can be uttered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  London. An apartment of the Prince's.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCE OF WALES and FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Hal, what time of day is it, lad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art so fat-witted, with drinking of old sack</div>
                     <div class="line">and unbuttoning thee after supper and sleeping upon</div>
                     <div class="line">benches after noon, that thou hast forgotten to</div>
                     <div class="line">demand that truly which thou wouldst truly know.</div>
                     <div class="line">What a devil hast thou to do with the time of the</div>
                     <div class="line">day? Unless hours were cups of sack and minutes</div>
                     <div class="line">capons and clocks the tongues of bawds and dials the</div>
                     <div class="line">signs of leaping-houses and the blessed sun himself</div>
                     <div class="line">a fair hot wench in flame-coloured taffeta, I see no</div>
                     <div class="line">reason why thou shouldst be so superfluous to demand</div>
                     <div class="line">the time of the day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, you come near me now, Hal; for we that take</div>
                     <div class="line">purses go by the moon and the seven stars, and not</div>
                     <div class="line">by Phoebus, he,'that wandering knight so fair.' And,</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, sweet wag, when thou art king, as, God</div>
                     <div class="line">save thy grace,--majesty I should say, for grace</div>
                     <div class="line">thou wilt have none,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, none?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by my troth, not so much as will serve to</div>
                     <div class="line">prologue to an egg and butter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, how then? come, roundly, roundly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, then, sweet wag, when thou art king, let not</div>
                     <div class="line">us that are squires of the night's body be called</div>
                     <div class="line">thieves of the day's beauty: let us be Diana's</div>
                     <div class="line">foresters, gentlemen of the shade, minions of the</div>
                     <div class="line">moon; and let men say we be men of good government,</div>
                     <div class="line">being governed, as the sea is, by our noble and</div>
                     <div class="line">chaste mistress the moon, under whose countenance we steal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sayest well, and it holds well too; for the</div>
                     <div class="line">fortune of us that are the moon's men doth ebb and</div>
                     <div class="line">flow like the sea, being governed, as the sea is,</div>
                     <div class="line">by the moon. As, for proof, now: a purse of gold</div>
                     <div class="line">most resolutely snatched on Monday night and most</div>
                     <div class="line">dissolutely spent on Tuesday morning; got with</div>
                     <div class="line">swearing 'Lay by' and spent with crying 'Bring in;'</div>
                     <div class="line">now in as low an ebb as the foot of the ladder</div>
                     <div class="line">and by and by in as high a flow as the ridge of the gallows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">By the Lord, thou sayest true, lad. And is not my</div>
                     <div class="line">hostess of the tavern a most sweet wench?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">As the honey of Hybla, my old lad of the castle. And</div>
                     <div class="line">is not a buff jerkin a most sweet robe of durance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, how now, mad wag! what, in thy quips and</div>
                     <div class="line">thy quiddities? what a plague have I to do with a</div>
                     <div class="line">buff jerkin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a pox have I to do with my hostess of the tavern?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, thou hast called her to a reckoning many a</div>
                     <div class="line">time and oft.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I ever call for thee to pay thy part?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No; I'll give thee thy due, thou hast paid all there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, and elsewhere, so far as my coin would stretch;</div>
                     <div class="line">and where it would not, I have used my credit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, and so used it that were it not here apparent</div>
                     <div class="line">that thou art heir apparent--But, I prithee, sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">wag, shall there be gallows standing in England when</div>
                     <div class="line">thou art king? and resolution thus fobbed as it is</div>
                     <div class="line">with the rusty curb of old father antic the law? Do</div>
                     <div class="line">not thou, when thou art king, hang a thief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">No; thou shalt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I? O rare! By the Lord, I'll be a brave judge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou judgest false already: I mean, thou shalt have</div>
                     <div class="line">the hanging of the thieves and so become a rare hangman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, Hal, well; and in some sort it jumps with my</div>
                     <div class="line">humour as well as waiting in the court, I can tell</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">For obtaining of suits?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, for obtaining of suits, whereof the hangman</div>
                     <div class="line">hath no lean wardrobe. 'Sblood, I am as melancholy</div>
                     <div class="line">as a gib cat or a lugged bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Or an old lion, or a lover's lute.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, or the drone of a Lincolnshire bagpipe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayest thou to a hare, or the melancholy of</div>
                     <div class="line">Moor-ditch?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast the most unsavoury similes and art indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">the most comparative, rascalliest, sweet young</div>
                     <div class="line">prince. But, Hal, I prithee, trouble me no more</div>
                     <div class="line">with vanity. I would to God thou and I knew where a</div>
                     <div class="line">commodity of good names were to be bought. An old</div>
                     <div class="line">lord of the council rated me the other day in the</div>
                     <div class="line">street about you, sir, but I marked him not; and yet</div>
                     <div class="line">he talked very wisely, but I regarded him not; and</div>
                     <div class="line">yet he talked wisely, and in the street too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou didst well; for wisdom cries out in the</div>
                     <div class="line">streets, and no man regards it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thou hast damnable iteration and art indeed able</div>
                     <div class="line">to corrupt a saint. Thou hast done much harm upon</div>
                     <div class="line">me, Hal; God forgive thee for it! Before I knew</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, Hal, I knew nothing; and now am I, if a man</div>
                     <div class="line">should speak truly, little better than one of the</div>
                     <div class="line">wicked. I must give over this life, and I will give</div>
                     <div class="line">it over: by the Lord, and I do not, I am a villain:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be damned for never a king's son in</div>
                     <div class="line">Christendom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall we take a purse tomorrow, Jack?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Zounds, where thou wilt, lad; I'll make one; an I</div>
                     <div class="line">do not, call me villain and baffle me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I see a good amendment of life in thee; from praying</div>
                     <div class="line">to purse-taking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Hal, 'tis my vocation, Hal; 'tis no sin for a</div>
                     <div class="line">man to labour in his vocation.</div>
                     <p>Enter POINS</p>
                     <div class="line">Poins! Now shall we know if Gadshill have set a</div>
                     <div class="line">match. O, if men were to be saved by merit, what</div>
                     <div class="line">hole in hell were hot enough for him? This is the</div>
                     <div class="line">most omnipotent villain that ever cried 'Stand' to</div>
                     <div class="line">a true man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Ned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, sweet Hal. What says Monsieur Remorse?</div>
                     <div class="line">what says Sir John Sack and Sugar? Jack! how</div>
                     <div class="line">agrees the devil and thee about thy soul, that thou</div>
                     <div class="line">soldest him on Good-Friday last for a cup of Madeira</div>
                     <div class="line">and a cold capon's leg?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John stands to his word, the devil shall have</div>
                     <div class="line">his bargain; for he was never yet a breaker of</div>
                     <div class="line">proverbs: he will give the devil his due.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Then art thou damned for keeping thy word with the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Else he had been damned for cozening the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">But, my lads, my lads, to-morrow morning, by four</div>
                     <div class="line">o'clock, early at Gadshill! there are pilgrims going</div>
                     <div class="line">to Canterbury with rich offerings, and traders</div>
                     <div class="line">riding to London with fat purses: I have vizards</div>
                     <div class="line">for you all; you have horses for yourselves:</div>
                     <div class="line">Gadshill lies to-night in Rochester: I have bespoke</div>
                     <div class="line">supper to-morrow night in Eastcheap: we may do it</div>
                     <div class="line">as secure as sleep. If you will go, I will stuff</div>
                     <div class="line">your purses full of crowns; if you will not, tarry</div>
                     <div class="line">at home and be hanged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear ye, Yedward; if I tarry at home and go not,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll hang you for going.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">You will, chops?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Hal, wilt thou make one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, I rob? I a thief? not I, by my faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">There's neither honesty, manhood, nor good</div>
                     <div class="line">fellowship in thee, nor thou camest not of the blood</div>
                     <div class="line">royal, if thou darest not stand for ten shillings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well then, once in my days I'll be a madcap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that's well said.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, come what will, I'll tarry at home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">By the Lord, I'll be a traitor then, when thou art king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I care not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John, I prithee, leave the prince and me alone:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will lay him down such reasons for this adventure</div>
                     <div class="line">that he shall go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, God give thee the spirit of persuasion and him</div>
                     <div class="line">the ears of profiting, that what thou speakest may</div>
                     <div class="line">move and what he hears may be believed, that the</div>
                     <div class="line">true prince may, for recreation sake, prove a false</div>
                     <div class="line">thief; for the poor abuses of the time want</div>
                     <div class="line">countenance. Farewell: you shall find me in Eastcheap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, thou latter spring! farewell, All-hallown summer!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Falstaff</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, my good sweet honey lord, ride with us</div>
                     <div class="line">to-morrow: I have a jest to execute that I cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">manage alone. Falstaff, Bardolph, Peto and Gadshill</div>
                     <div class="line">shall rob those men that we have already waylaid:</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself and I will not be there; and when they</div>
                     <div class="line">have the booty, if you and I do not rob them, cut</div>
                     <div class="line">this head off from my shoulders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall we part with them in setting forth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, we will set forth before or after them, and</div>
                     <div class="line">appoint them a place of meeting, wherein it is at</div>
                     <div class="line">our pleasure to fail, and then will they adventure</div>
                     <div class="line">upon the exploit themselves; which they shall have</div>
                     <div class="line">no sooner achieved, but we'll set upon them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, but 'tis like that they will know us by our</div>
                     <div class="line">horses, by our habits and by every other</div>
                     <div class="line">appointment, to be ourselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut! our horses they shall not see: I'll tie them</div>
                     <div class="line">in the wood; our vizards we will change after we</div>
                     <div class="line">leave them: and, sirrah, I have cases of buckram</div>
                     <div class="line">for the nonce, to immask our noted outward garments.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, but I doubt they will be too hard for us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, for two of them, I know them to be as</div>
                     <div class="line">true-bred cowards as ever turned back; and for the</div>
                     <div class="line">third, if he fight longer than he sees reason, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">forswear arms. The virtue of this jest will be, the</div>
                     <div class="line">incomprehensible lies that this same fat rogue will</div>
                     <div class="line">tell us when we meet at supper: how thirty, at</div>
                     <div class="line">least, he fought with; what wards, what blows, what</div>
                     <div class="line">extremities he endured; and in the reproof of this</div>
                     <div class="line">lies the jest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll go with thee: provide us all things</div>
                     <div class="line">necessary and meet me to-morrow night in Eastcheap;</div>
                     <div class="line">there I'll sup. Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Poins</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you all, and will awhile uphold</div>
                     <div class="line">The unyoked humour of your idleness:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet herein will I imitate the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who doth permit the base contagious clouds</div>
                     <div class="line">To smother up his beauty from the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, when he please again to be himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being wanted, he may be more wonder'd at,</div>
                     <div class="line">By breaking through the foul and ugly mists</div>
                     <div class="line">Of vapours that did seem to strangle him.</div>
                     <div class="line">If all the year were playing holidays,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sport would be as tedious as to work;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when they seldom come, they wish'd for come,</div>
                     <div class="line">And nothing pleaseth but rare accidents.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, when this loose behavior I throw off</div>
                     <div class="line">And pay the debt I never promised,</div>
                     <div class="line">By how much better than my word I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">By so much shall I falsify men's hopes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like bright metal on a sullen ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">My reformation, glittering o'er my fault,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall show more goodly and attract more eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that which hath no foil to set it off.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll so offend, to make offence a skill;</div>
                     <div class="line">Redeeming time when men think least I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the KING, NORTHUMBERLAND, WORCESTER, HOTSPUR,
SIR WALTER BLUNT, with others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">My blood hath been too cold and temperate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unapt to stir at these indignities,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you have found me; for accordingly</div>
                     <div class="line">You tread upon my patience: but be sure</div>
                     <div class="line">I will from henceforth rather be myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mighty and to be fear'd, than my condition;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which hath been smooth as oil, soft as young down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore lost that title of respect</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the proud soul ne'er pays but to the proud.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Our house, my sovereign liege, little deserves</div>
                     <div class="line">The scourge of greatness to be used on it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that same greatness too which our own hands</div>
                     <div class="line">Have holp to make so portly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord.--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Worcester, get thee gone; for I do see</div>
                     <div class="line">Danger and disobedience in thine eye:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, your presence is too bold and peremptory,</div>
                     <div class="line">And majesty might never yet endure</div>
                     <div class="line">The moody frontier of a servant brow.</div>
                     <div class="line">You have good leave to leave us: when we need</div>
                     <div class="line">Your use and counsel, we shall send for you.</div>
                     <p>Exit Worcester</p>
                     <div class="line">You were about to speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>To North</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, my good lord.</div>
                     <div class="line">Those prisoners in your highness' name demanded,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which Harry Percy here at Holmedon took,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were, as he says, not with such strength denied</div>
                     <div class="line">As is deliver'd to your majesty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Either envy, therefore, or misprison</div>
                     <div class="line">Is guilty of this fault and not my son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, I did deny no prisoners.</div>
                     <div class="line">But I remember, when the fight was done,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was dry with rage and extreme toil,</div>
                     <div class="line">Breathless and faint, leaning upon my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Came there a certain lord, neat, and trimly dress'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fresh as a bridegroom; and his chin new reap'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Show'd like a stubble-land at harvest-home;</div>
                     <div class="line">He was perfumed like a milliner;</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'twixt his finger and his thumb he held</div>
                     <div class="line">A pouncet-box, which ever and anon</div>
                     <div class="line">He gave his nose and took't away again;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who therewith angry, when it next came there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Took it in snuff; and still he smiled and talk'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And as the soldiers bore dead bodies by,</div>
                     <div class="line">He call'd them untaught knaves, unmannerly,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring a slovenly unhandsome corse</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt the wind and his nobility.</div>
                     <div class="line">With many holiday and lady terms</div>
                     <div class="line">He question'd me; amongst the rest, demanded</div>
                     <div class="line">My prisoners in your majesty's behalf.</div>
                     <div class="line">I then, all smarting with my wounds being cold,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be so pester'd with a popinjay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of my grief and my impatience,</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer'd neglectingly I know not what,</div>
                     <div class="line">He should or he should not; for he made me mad</div>
                     <div class="line">To see him shine so brisk and smell so sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">And talk so like a waiting-gentlewoman</div>
                     <div class="line">Of guns and drums and wounds,--God save the mark!--</div>
                     <div class="line">And telling me the sovereign'st thing on earth</div>
                     <div class="line">Was parmaceti for an inward bruise;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that it was great pity, so it was,</div>
                     <div class="line">This villanous salt-petre should be digg'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the bowels of the harmless earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which many a good tall fellow had destroy'd</div>
                     <div class="line">So cowardly; and but for these vile guns,</div>
                     <div class="line">He would himself have been a soldier.</div>
                     <div class="line">This bald unjointed chat of his, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I answer'd indirectly, as I said;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I beseech you, let not his report</div>
                     <div class="line">Come current for an accusation</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt my love and your high majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">The circumstance consider'd, good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whate'er Lord Harry Percy then had said</div>
                     <div class="line">To such a person and in such a place,</div>
                     <div class="line">At such a time, with all the rest retold,</div>
                     <div class="line">May reasonably die and never rise</div>
                     <div class="line">To do him wrong or any way impeach</div>
                     <div class="line">What then he said, so he unsay it now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, yet he doth deny his prisoners,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with proviso and exception,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we at our own charge shall ransom straight</div>
                     <div class="line">His brother-in-law, the foolish Mortimer;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, on my soul, hath wilfully betray'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The lives of those that he did lead to fight</div>
                     <div class="line">Against that great magician, damn'd Glendower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose daughter, as we hear, the Earl of March</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath lately married. Shall our coffers, then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be emptied to redeem a traitor home?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we but treason? and indent with fears,</div>
                     <div class="line">When they have lost and forfeited themselves?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, on the barren mountains let him starve;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I shall never hold that man my friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose tongue shall ask me for one penny cost</div>
                     <div class="line">To ransom home revolted Mortimer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Revolted Mortimer!</div>
                     <div class="line">He never did fall off, my sovereign liege,</div>
                     <div class="line">But by the chance of war; to prove that true</div>
                     <div class="line">Needs no more but one tongue for all those wounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Those mouthed wounds, which valiantly he took</div>
                     <div class="line">When on the gentle Severn's sedgy bank,</div>
                     <div class="line">In single opposition, hand to hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">He did confound the best part of an hour</div>
                     <div class="line">In changing hardiment with great Glendower:</div>
                     <div class="line">Three times they breathed and three times did</div>
                     <div class="line">they drink,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon agreement, of swift Severn's flood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who then, affrighted with their bloody looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ran fearfully among the trembling reeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hid his crisp head in the hollow bank,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bloodstained with these valiant combatants.</div>
                     <div class="line">Never did base and rotten policy</div>
                     <div class="line">Colour her working with such deadly wounds;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor could the noble Mortimer</div>
                     <div class="line">Receive so many, and all willingly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let not him be slander'd with revolt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost belie him, Percy, thou dost belie him;</div>
                     <div class="line">He never did encounter with Glendower:</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">He durst as well have met the devil alone</div>
                     <div class="line">As Owen Glendower for an enemy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou not ashamed? But, sirrah, henceforth</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not hear you speak of Mortimer:</div>
                     <div class="line">Send me your prisoners with the speediest means,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or you shall hear in such a kind from me</div>
                     <div class="line">As will displease you. My Lord Northumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">We licence your departure with your son.</div>
                     <div class="line">Send us your prisoners, or you will hear of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt King Henry, Blunt, and train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">An if the devil come and roar for them,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not send them: I will after straight</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell him so; for I will ease my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit I make a hazard of my head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What, drunk with choler? stay and pause awhile:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes your uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter WORCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak of Mortimer!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Zounds, I will speak of him; and let my soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Want mercy, if I do not join with him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, on his part I'll empty all these veins,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shed my dear blood drop by drop in the dust,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will lift the down-trod Mortimer</div>
                     <div class="line">As high in the air as this unthankful king,</div>
                     <div class="line">As this ingrate and canker'd Bolingbroke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, the king hath made your nephew mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Who struck this heat up after I was gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">He will, forsooth, have all my prisoners;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I urged the ransom once again</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my wife's brother, then his cheek look'd pale,</div>
                     <div class="line">And on my face he turn'd an eye of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Trembling even at the name of Mortimer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot blame him: was not he proclaim'd</div>
                     <div class="line">By Richard that dead is the next of blood?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">He was; I heard the proclamation:</div>
                     <div class="line">And then it was when the unhappy king,</div>
                     <div class="line">--Whose wrongs in us God pardon!--did set forth</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his Irish expedition;</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence he intercepted did return</div>
                     <div class="line">To be deposed and shortly murdered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And for whose death we in the world's wide mouth</div>
                     <div class="line">Live scandalized and foully spoken of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">But soft, I pray you; did King Richard then</div>
                     <div class="line">Proclaim my brother Edmund Mortimer</div>
                     <div class="line">Heir to the crown?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">He did; myself did hear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then I cannot blame his cousin king,</div>
                     <div class="line">That wished him on the barren mountains starve.</div>
                     <div class="line">But shall it be that you, that set the crown</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the head of this forgetful man</div>
                     <div class="line">And for his sake wear the detested blot</div>
                     <div class="line">Of murderous subornation, shall it be,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you a world of curses undergo,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being the agents, or base second means,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cords, the ladder, or the hangman rather?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pardon me that I descend so low,</div>
                     <div class="line">To show the line and the predicament</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein you range under this subtle king;</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall it for shame be spoken in these days,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or fill up chronicles in time to come,</div>
                     <div class="line">That men of your nobility and power</div>
                     <div class="line">Did gage them both in an unjust behalf,</div>
                     <div class="line">As both of you--God pardon it!--have done,</div>
                     <div class="line">To put down Richard, that sweet lovely rose,</div>
                     <div class="line">An plant this thorn, this canker, Bolingbroke?</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall it in more shame be further spoken,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you are fool'd, discarded and shook off</div>
                     <div class="line">By him for whom these shames ye underwent?</div>
                     <div class="line">No; yet time serves wherein you may redeem</div>
                     <div class="line">Your banish'd honours and restore yourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the good thoughts of the world again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Revenge the jeering and disdain'd contempt</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this proud king, who studies day and night</div>
                     <div class="line">To answer all the debt he owes to you</div>
                     <div class="line">Even with the bloody payment of your deaths:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, I say--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, cousin, say no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I will unclasp a secret book,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to your quick-conceiving discontents</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll read you matter deep and dangerous,</div>
                     <div class="line">As full of peril and adventurous spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">As to o'er-walk a current roaring loud</div>
                     <div class="line">On the unsteadfast footing of a spear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">If he fall in, good night! or sink or swim:</div>
                     <div class="line">Send danger from the east unto the west,</div>
                     <div class="line">So honour cross it from the north to south,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let them grapple: O, the blood more stirs</div>
                     <div class="line">To rouse a lion than to start a hare!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Imagination of some great exploit</div>
                     <div class="line">Drives him beyond the bounds of patience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, methinks it were an easy leap,</div>
                     <div class="line">To pluck bright honour from the pale-faced moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or dive into the bottom of the deep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where fathom-line could never touch the ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pluck up drowned honour by the locks;</div>
                     <div class="line">So he that doth redeem her thence might wear</div>
                     <div class="line">Without corrival, all her dignities:</div>
                     <div class="line">But out upon this half-faced fellowship!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He apprehends a world of figures here,</div>
                     <div class="line">But not the form of what he should attend.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good cousin, give me audience for a while.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I cry you mercy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Those same noble Scots</div>
                     <div class="line">That are your prisoners,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll keep them all;</div>
                     <div class="line">By God, he shall not have a Scot of them;</div>
                     <div class="line">No, if a Scot would save his soul, he shall not:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll keep them, by this hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">You start away</div>
                     <div class="line">And lend no ear unto my purposes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Those prisoners you shall keep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I will; that's flat:</div>
                     <div class="line">He said he would not ransom Mortimer;</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbad my tongue to speak of Mortimer;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will find him when he lies asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his ear I'll holla 'Mortimer!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have a starling shall be taught to speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but 'Mortimer,' and give it him</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep his anger still in motion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear you, cousin; a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">All studies here I solemnly defy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Save how to gall and pinch this Bolingbroke:</div>
                     <div class="line">And that same sword-and-buckler Prince of Wales,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I think his father loves him not</div>
                     <div class="line">And would be glad he met with some mischance,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have him poison'd with a pot of ale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, kinsman: I'll talk to you</div>
                     <div class="line">When you are better temper'd to attend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a wasp-stung and impatient fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou to break into this woman's mood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tying thine ear to no tongue but thine own!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, look you, I am whipp'd and scourged with rods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nettled and stung with pismires, when I hear</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this vile politician, Bolingbroke.</div>
                     <div class="line">In Richard's time,--what do you call the place?--</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon it, it is in Gloucestershire;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas where the madcap duke his uncle kept,</div>
                     <div class="line">His uncle York; where I first bow'd my knee</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto this king of smiles, this Bolingbroke,--</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sblood!--</div>
                     <div class="line">When you and he came back from Ravenspurgh.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">At Berkley castle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">You say true:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a candy deal of courtesy</div>
                     <div class="line">This fawning greyhound then did proffer me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look,'when his infant fortune came to age,'</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'gentle Harry Percy,' and 'kind cousin;'</div>
                     <div class="line">O, the devil take such cozeners! God forgive me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Good uncle, tell your tale; I have done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if you have not, to it again;</div>
                     <div class="line">We will stay your leisure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I have done, i' faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Then once more to your Scottish prisoners.</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver them up without their ransom straight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make the Douglas' son your only mean</div>
                     <div class="line">For powers in Scotland; which, for divers reasons</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I shall send you written, be assured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will easily be granted. You, my lord,</div>
                     <p>To Northumberland</p>
                     <div class="line">Your son in Scotland being thus employ'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall secretly into the bosom creep</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that same noble prelate, well beloved,</div>
                     <div class="line">The archbishop.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Of York, is it not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">True; who bears hard</div>
                     <div class="line">His brother's death at Bristol, the Lord Scroop.</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak not this in estimation,</div>
                     <div class="line">As what I think might be, but what I know</div>
                     <div class="line">Is ruminated, plotted and set down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And only stays but to behold the face</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that occasion that shall bring it on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I smell it: upon my life, it will do well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the game is afoot, thou still let'st slip.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, it cannot choose but be a noble plot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then the power of Scotland and of York,</div>
