                     <div class="line">To join with Mortimer, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And so they shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, it is exceedingly well aim'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'tis no little reason bids us speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">To save our heads by raising of a head;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, bear ourselves as even as we can,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king will always think him in our debt,</div>
                     <div class="line">And think we think ourselves unsatisfied,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he hath found a time to pay us home:</div>
                     <div class="line">And see already how he doth begin</div>
                     <div class="line">To make us strangers to his looks of love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">He does, he does: we'll be revenged on him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, farewell: no further go in this</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I by letters shall direct your course.</div>
                     <div class="line">When time is ripe, which will be suddenly,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll steal to Glendower and Lord Mortimer;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you and Douglas and our powers at once,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I will fashion it, shall happily meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear our fortunes in our own strong arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now we hold at much uncertainty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, good brother: we shall thrive, I trust.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, Adieu: O, let the hours be short</div>
                     <div class="line">Till fields and blows and groans applaud our sport!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Rochester. An inn yard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The highway, near Gadshill.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  Warkworth castle</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rochester. An inn yard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Carrier with a lantern in his hand</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Heigh-ho! an it be not four by the day, I'll be</div>
                     <div class="line">hanged: Charles' wain is over the new chimney, and</div>
                     <div class="line">yet our horse not packed. What, ostler!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Ostler</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>   Anon, anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, Tom, beat Cut's saddle, put a few flocks</div>
                     <div class="line">in the point; poor jade, is wrung in the withers out</div>
                     <div class="line">of all cess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter another Carrier</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Peas and beans are as dank here as a dog, and that</div>
                     <div class="line">is the next way to give poor jades the bots: this</div>
                     <div class="line">house is turned upside down since Robin Ostler died.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor fellow, never joyed since the price of oats</div>
                     <div class="line">rose; it was the death of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">I think this be the most villanous house in all</div>
                     <div class="line">London road for fleas: I am stung like a tench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a tench! by the mass, there is ne'er a king</div>
                     <div class="line">christen could be better bit than I have been since</div>
                     <div class="line">the first cock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, they will allow us ne'er a jordan, and then we</div>
                     <div class="line">leak in your chimney; and your chamber-lie breeds</div>
                     <div class="line">fleas like a loach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ostler! come away and be hanged!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a gammon of bacon and two razors of ginger,</div>
                     <div class="line">to be delivered as far as Charing-cross.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">God's body! the turkeys in my pannier are quite</div>
                     <div class="line">starved. What, ostler! A plague on thee! hast thou</div>
                     <div class="line">never an eye in thy head? canst not hear? An</div>
                     <div class="line">'twere not as good deed as drink, to break the pate</div>
                     <div class="line">on thee, I am a very villain. Come, and be hanged!</div>
                     <div class="line">hast thou no faith in thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GADSHILL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, carriers. What's o'clock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it be two o'clock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee lend me thy lantern, to see my gelding</div>
                     <div class="line">in the stable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, by God, soft; I know a trick worth two of that, i' faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, lend me thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, when? can'st tell? Lend me thy lantern, quoth</div>
                     <div class="line">he? marry, I'll see thee hanged first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah carrier, what time do you mean to come to London?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Carrier</div>
                     <div class="line">Time enough to go to bed with a candle, I warrant</div>
                     <div class="line">thee. Come, neighbour Mugs, we'll call up the</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman: they will along with company, for they</div>
                     <div class="line">have great charge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt carriers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho! chamberlain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  At hand, quoth pick-purse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">That's even as fair as--at hand, quoth the</div>
                     <div class="line">chamberlain; for thou variest no more from picking</div>
                     <div class="line">of purses than giving direction doth from labouring;</div>
                     <div class="line">thou layest the plot how.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Chamberlain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Master Gadshill. It holds current that</div>
                     <div class="line">I told you yesternight: there's a franklin in the</div>
                     <div class="line">wild of Kent hath brought three hundred marks with</div>
                     <div class="line">him in gold: I heard him tell it to one of his</div>
                     <div class="line">company last night at supper; a kind of auditor; one</div>
                     <div class="line">that hath abundance of charge too, God knows what.</div>
                     <div class="line">They are up already, and call for eggs and butter;</div>
                     <div class="line">they will away presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, if they meet not with Saint Nicholas'</div>
                     <div class="line">clerks, I'll give thee this neck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll none of it: I pray thee keep that for the</div>
                     <div class="line">hangman; for I know thou worshippest St. Nicholas</div>
                     <div class="line">as truly as a man of falsehood may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">What talkest thou to me of the hangman? if I hang,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make a fat pair of gallows; for if I hang, old</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John hangs with me, and thou knowest he is no</div>
                     <div class="line">starveling. Tut! there are other Trojans that thou</div>
                     <div class="line">dreamest not of, the which for sport sake are</div>
                     <div class="line">content to do the profession some grace; that would,</div>
                     <div class="line">if matters should be looked into, for their own</div>
                     <div class="line">credit sake, make all whole. I am joined with no</div>
                     <div class="line">foot-land rakers, no long-staff sixpenny strikers,</div>
                     <div class="line">none of these mad mustachio purple-hued malt-worms;</div>
                     <div class="line">but with nobility and tranquillity, burgomasters and</div>
                     <div class="line">great oneyers, such as can hold in, such as will</div>
                     <div class="line">strike sooner than speak, and speak sooner than</div>
                     <div class="line">drink, and drink sooner than pray: and yet, zounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">I lie; for they pray continually to their saint, the</div>
                     <div class="line">commonwealth; or rather, not pray to her, but prey</div>
                     <div class="line">on her, for they ride up and down on her and make</div>
                     <div class="line">her their boots.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">What, the commonwealth their boots? will she hold</div>
                     <div class="line">out water in foul way?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">She will, she will; justice hath liquored her. We</div>
                     <div class="line">steal as in a castle, cocksure; we have the receipt</div>
                     <div class="line">of fern-seed, we walk invisible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, by my faith, I think you are more beholding to</div>
                     <div class="line">the night than to fern-seed for your walking invisible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand: thou shalt have a share in our</div>
                     <div class="line">purchase, as I am a true man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, rather let me have it, as you are a false thief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; 'homo' is a common name to all men. Bid the</div>
                     <div class="line">ostler bring my gelding out of the stable. Farewell,</div>
                     <div class="line">you muddy knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The highway, near Gadshill.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shelter, shelter: I have removed Falstaff's</div>
                     <div class="line">horse, and he frets like a gummed velvet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand close.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Poins! Poins, and be hanged! Poins!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ye fat-kidneyed rascal! what a brawling dost</div>
                     <div class="line">thou keep!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Poins, Hal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">He is walked up to the top of the hill: I'll go seek him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I am accursed to rob in that thief's company: the</div>
                     <div class="line">rascal hath removed my horse, and tied him I know</div>
                     <div class="line">not where. If I travel but four foot by the squier</div>
                     <div class="line">further afoot, I shall break my wind. Well, I doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">not but to die a fair death for all this, if I</div>
                     <div class="line">'scape hanging for killing that rogue. I have</div>
                     <div class="line">forsworn his company hourly any time this two and</div>
                     <div class="line">twenty years, and yet I am bewitched with the</div>
                     <div class="line">rogue's company. If the rascal hath not given me</div>
                     <div class="line">medicines to make me love him, I'll be hanged; it</div>
                     <div class="line">could not be else: I have drunk medicines. Poins!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hal! a plague upon you both! Bardolph! Peto!</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll starve ere I'll rob a foot further. An 'twere</div>
                     <div class="line">not as good a deed as drink, to turn true man and to</div>
                     <div class="line">leave these rogues, I am the veriest varlet that</div>
                     <div class="line">ever chewed with a tooth. Eight yards of uneven</div>
                     <div class="line">ground is threescore and ten miles afoot with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">and the stony-hearted villains know it well enough:</div>
                     <div class="line">a plague upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!</div>
                     <p>They whistle</p>
                     <div class="line">Whew! A plague upon you all! Give me my horse, you</div>
                     <div class="line">rogues; give me my horse, and be hanged!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ye fat-guts! lie down; lay thine ear close</div>
                     <div class="line">to the ground and list if thou canst hear the tread</div>
                     <div class="line">of travellers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you any levers to lift me up again, being down?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sblood, I'll not bear mine own flesh so far afoot</div>
                     <div class="line">again for all the coin in thy father's exchequer.</div>
                     <div class="line">What a plague mean ye to colt me thus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou liest; thou art not colted, thou art uncolted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, good Prince Hal, help me to my horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">good king's son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, ye rogue! shall I be your ostler?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, hang thyself in thine own heir-apparent</div>
                     <div class="line">garters! If I be ta'en, I'll peach for this. An I</div>
                     <div class="line">have not ballads made on you all and sung to filthy</div>
                     <div class="line">tunes, let a cup of sack be my poison: when a jest</div>
                     <div class="line">is so forward, and afoot too! I hate it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GADSHILL, BARDOLPH and PETO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">So I do, against my will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, 'tis our setter: I know his voice. Bardolph,</div>
                     <div class="line">what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Case ye, case ye; on with your vizards: there 's</div>
                     <div class="line">money of the king's coming down the hill; 'tis going</div>
                     <div class="line">to the king's exchequer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">You lie, ye rogue; 'tis going to the king's tavern.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">There's enough to make us all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">To be hanged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirs, you four shall front them in the narrow lane;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ned Poins and I will walk lower: if they 'scape</div>
                     <div class="line">from your encounter, then they light on us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                     <div class="line">How many be there of them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">Some eight or ten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Zounds, will they not rob us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, a coward, Sir John Paunch?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, I am not John of Gaunt, your grandfather;</div>
                     <div class="line">but yet no coward, Hal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we leave that to the proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah Jack, thy horse stands behind the hedge:</div>
                     <div class="line">when thou needest him, there thou shalt find him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, and stand fast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Now cannot I strike him, if I should be hanged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ned, where are our disguises?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, hard by: stand close.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PRINCE HENRY and POINS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, my masters, happy man be his dole, say I:</div>
                     <div class="line">every man to his business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Travellers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Traveller</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, neighbour: the boy shall lead our horses down</div>
                     <div class="line">the hill; we'll walk afoot awhile, and ease our legs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thieves</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Travellers</div>
                     <div class="line">Jesus bless us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike; down with them; cut the villains' throats:</div>
                     <div class="line">ah! whoreson caterpillars! bacon-fed knaves! they</div>
                     <div class="line">hate us youth: down with them: fleece them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Travellers</div>
                     <div class="line">O, we are undone, both we and ours for ever!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang ye, gorbellied knaves, are ye undone? No, ye</div>
                     <div class="line">fat chuffs: I would your store were here! On,</div>
                     <div class="line">bacons, on! What, ye knaves! young men must live.</div>
                     <div class="line">You are Grand-jurors, are ye? we'll jure ye, 'faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Here they rob them and bind them. Exeunt</p>
               <p>Re-enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">The thieves have bound the true men. Now could thou</div>
                     <div class="line">and I rob the thieves and go merrily to London, it</div>
                     <div class="line">would be argument for a week, laughter for a month</div>
                     <div class="line">and a good jest for ever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand close; I hear them coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Thieves again</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, my masters, let us share, and then to horse</div>
                     <div class="line">before day. An the Prince and Poins be not two</div>
                     <div class="line">arrant cowards, there's no equity stirring: there's</div>
                     <div class="line">no more valour in that Poins than in a wild-duck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Your money!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Villains!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>As they are sharing, the Prince and Poins set upon
them; they all run away; and Falstaff, after a blow
or two, runs away too, leaving the booty behind them</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Got with much ease. Now merrily to horse:</div>
                     <div class="line">The thieves are all scatter'd and possess'd with fear</div>
                     <div class="line">So strongly that they dare not meet each other;</div>
                     <div class="line">Each takes his fellow for an officer.</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, good Ned. Falstaff sweats to death,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lards the lean earth as he walks along:</div>
                     <div class="line">Were 't not for laughing, I should pity him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">How the rogue roar'd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Warkworth castle</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HOTSPUR, solus, reading a letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">'But for mine own part, my lord, I could be well</div>
                     <div class="line">contented to be there, in respect of the love I bear</div>
                     <div class="line">your house.' He could be contented: why is he not,</div>
                     <div class="line">then? In respect of the love he bears our house:</div>
                     <div class="line">he shows in this, he loves his own barn better than</div>
                     <div class="line">he loves our house. Let me see some more. 'The</div>
                     <div class="line">purpose you undertake is dangerous;'--why, that's</div>
                     <div class="line">certain: 'tis dangerous to take a cold, to sleep, to</div>
                     <div class="line">drink; but I tell you, my lord fool, out of this</div>
                     <div class="line">nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety. 'The</div>
                     <div class="line">purpose you undertake is dangerous; the friends you</div>
                     <div class="line">have named uncertain; the time itself unsorted; and</div>
                     <div class="line">your whole plot too light for the counterpoise of so</div>
                     <div class="line">great an opposition.' Say you so, say you so? I say</div>
                     <div class="line">unto you again, you are a shallow cowardly hind, and</div>
                     <div class="line">you lie.  What a lack-brain is this! By the Lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">our plot is a good plot as ever was laid; our</div>
                     <div class="line">friends true and constant: a good plot, good</div>
                     <div class="line">friends, and full of expectation; an excellent plot,</div>
                     <div class="line">very good friends. What a frosty-spirited rogue is</div>
                     <div class="line">this! Why, my lord of York commends the plot and the</div>
                     <div class="line">general course of action. 'Zounds, an I were now by</div>
                     <div class="line">this rascal, I could brain him with his lady's fan.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there not my father, my uncle and myself? lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Edmund Mortimer, My lord of York and Owen Glendower?</div>
                     <div class="line">is there not besides the Douglas? have I not all</div>
                     <div class="line">their letters to meet me in arms by the ninth of the</div>
                     <div class="line">next month? and are they not some of them set</div>
                     <div class="line">forward already? What a pagan rascal is this! an</div>
                     <div class="line">infidel! Ha! you shall see now in very sincerity</div>
                     <div class="line">of fear and cold heart, will he to the king and lay</div>
                     <div class="line">open all our proceedings. O, I could divide myself</div>
                     <div class="line">and go to buffets, for moving such a dish of</div>
                     <div class="line">skim milk with so honourable an action! Hang him!</div>
                     <div class="line">let him tell the king: we are prepared. I will set</div>
                     <div class="line">forward to-night.</div>
                     <p>Enter LADY PERCY</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Kate! I must leave you within these two hours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my good lord, why are you thus alone?</div>
                     <div class="line">For what offence have I this fortnight been</div>
                     <div class="line">A banish'd woman from my Harry's bed?</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, sweet lord, what is't that takes from thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy stomach, pleasure and thy golden sleep?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou bend thine eyes upon the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And start so often when thou sit'st alone?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why hast thou lost the fresh blood in thy cheeks;</div>
                     <div class="line">And given my treasures and my rights of thee</div>
                     <div class="line">To thick-eyed musing and cursed melancholy?</div>
                     <div class="line">In thy faint slumbers I by thee have watch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And heard thee murmur tales of iron wars;</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak terms of manage to thy bounding steed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry 'Courage! to the field!' And thou hast talk'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Of sallies and retires, of trenches, tents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of palisadoes, frontiers, parapets,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of basilisks, of cannon, culverin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of prisoners' ransom and of soldiers slain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the currents of a heady fight.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy spirit within thee hath been so at war</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus hath so bestirr'd thee in thy sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">That beads of sweat have stood upon thy brow</div>
                     <div class="line">Like bubbles in a late-disturbed stream;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in thy face strange motions have appear'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as we see when men restrain their breath</div>
                     <div class="line">On some great sudden hest. O, what portents are these?</div>
                     <div class="line">Some heavy business hath my lord in hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I must know it, else he loves me not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho!</div>
                     <p>Enter Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Is Gilliams with the packet gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">He is, my lord, an hour ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath Butler brought those horses from the sheriff?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">One horse, my lord, he brought even now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">What horse? a roan, a crop-ear, is it not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">It is, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">That roan shall by my throne.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will back him straight: O esperance!</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid Butler lead him forth into the park.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">But hear you, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou, my lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">What is it carries you away?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, my horse, my love, my horse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, you mad-headed ape!</div>
                     <div class="line">A weasel hath not such a deal of spleen</div>
                     <div class="line">As you are toss'd with. In faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll know your business, Harry, that I will.</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear my brother Mortimer doth stir</div>
                     <div class="line">About his title, and hath sent for you</div>
                     <div class="line">To line his enterprise: but if you go,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">So far afoot, I shall be weary, love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, you paraquito, answer me</div>
                     <div class="line">Directly unto this question that I ask:</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, I'll break thy little finger, Harry,</div>
                     <div class="line">An if thou wilt not tell me all things true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, you trifler! Love! I love thee not,</div>
                     <div class="line">I care not for thee, Kate: this is no world</div>
                     <div class="line">To play with mammets and to tilt with lips:</div>
                     <div class="line">We must have bloody noses and crack'd crowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pass them current too. God's me, my horse!</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou, Kate? what would'st thou</div>
                     <div class="line">have with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not love me? do you not, indeed?</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, do not then; for since you love me not,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not love myself. Do you not love me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, tell me if you speak in jest or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, wilt thou see me ride?</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I am on horseback, I will swear</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee infinitely. But hark you, Kate;</div>
                     <div class="line">I must not have you henceforth question me</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither I go, nor reason whereabout:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither I must, I must; and, to conclude,</div>
                     <div class="line">This evening must I leave you, gentle Kate.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you wise, but yet no farther wise</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Harry Percy's wife: constant you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet a woman: and for secrecy,</div>
                     <div class="line">No lady closer; for I well believe</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt not utter what thou dost not know;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so far will I trust thee, gentle Kate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">How! so far?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Not an inch further. But hark you, Kate:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither I go, thither shall you go too;</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day will I set forth, to-morrow you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will this content you, Kate?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                     <div class="line">It must of force.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ned, prithee, come out of that fat room, and lend me</div>
                     <div class="line">thy hand to laugh a little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where hast been, Hal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">With three or four loggerheads amongst three or four</div>
                     <div class="line">score hogsheads. I have sounded the very</div>
                     <div class="line">base-string of humility. Sirrah, I am sworn brother</div>
                     <div class="line">to a leash of drawers; and can call them all by</div>
                     <div class="line">their christen names, as Tom, Dick, and Francis.</div>
                     <div class="line">They take it already upon their salvation, that</div>
                     <div class="line">though I be but the prince of Wales, yet I am king</div>
                     <div class="line">of courtesy; and tell me flatly I am no proud Jack,</div>
                     <div class="line">like Falstaff, but a Corinthian, a lad of mettle, a</div>
                     <div class="line">good boy, by the Lord, so they call me, and when I</div>
                     <div class="line">am king of England, I shall command all the good</div>
                     <div class="line">lads in Eastcheap. They call drinking deep, dyeing</div>
                     <div class="line">scarlet; and when you breathe in your watering, they</div>
                     <div class="line">cry  'hem!' and bid you play it off. To conclude, I</div>
                     <div class="line">am so good a proficient in one quarter of an hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">that I can drink with any tinker in his own language</div>
                     <div class="line">during my life. I tell thee, Ned, thou hast lost</div>
                     <div class="line">much honour, that thou wert not with me in this sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">action. But, sweet Ned,--to sweeten which name of</div>
                     <div class="line">Ned, I give thee this pennyworth of sugar, clapped</div>
                     <div class="line">even now into my hand by an under-skinker, one that</div>
                     <div class="line">never spake other English in his life than 'Eight</div>
                     <div class="line">shillings and sixpence' and 'You are welcome,' with</div>
                     <div class="line">this shrill addition, 'Anon, anon, sir! Score a pint</div>
                     <div class="line">of bastard in the Half-Moon,' or so. But, Ned, to</div>
                     <div class="line">drive away the time till Falstaff come, I prithee,</div>
                     <div class="line">do thou stand in some by-room, while I question my</div>
                     <div class="line">puny drawer to what end he gave me the sugar; and do</div>
                     <div class="line">thou never leave calling 'Francis,' that his tale</div>
                     <div class="line">to me may be nothing but 'Anon.' Step aside, and</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll show thee a precedent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art perfect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit POINS</p>
               <p>Enter FRANCIS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon, sir. Look down into the Pomgarnet, Ralph.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, Francis.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">How long hast thou to serve, Francis?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsooth, five years, and as much as to--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Five year! by'r lady, a long lease for the clinking</div>
                     <div class="line">of pewter. But, Francis, darest thou be so valiant</div>
                     <div class="line">as to play the coward with thy indenture and show it</div>
                     <div class="line">a fair pair of heels and run from it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, sir, I'll be sworn upon all the books in</div>
                     <div class="line">England, I could find in my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">How old art thou, Francis?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me see--about Michaelmas next I shall be--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, sir. Pray stay a little, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but hark you, Francis: for the sugar thou</div>
                     <div class="line">gavest me,'twas a pennyworth, wast't not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, I would it had been two!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I will give thee for it a thousand pound: ask me</div>
                     <div class="line">when thou wilt, and thou shalt have it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, Francis? No, Francis; but to-morrow, Francis;</div>
                     <div class="line">or, Francis, o' Thursday; or indeed, Francis, when</div>
                     <div class="line">thou wilt. But, Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou rob this leathern jerkin, crystal-button,</div>
                     <div class="line">not-pated, agate-ring, puke-stocking, caddis-garter,</div>
                     <div class="line">smooth-tongue, Spanish-pouch,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, sir, who do you mean?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, your brown bastard is your only drink;</div>
                     <div class="line">for look you, Francis, your white canvas doublet</div>
                     <div class="line">will sully: in Barbary, sir, it cannot come to so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Francis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, you rogue! dost thou not hear them call?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Here they both call him; the drawer stands amazed,
not knowing which way to go</p>
               <p>Enter Vintner</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Vintner</div>
                     <div class="line">What, standest thou still, and hearest such a</div>
                     <div class="line">calling? Look to the guests within.</div>
                     <p>Exit Francis</p>
                     <div class="line">My lord, old Sir John, with half-a-dozen more, are</div>
                     <div class="line">at the door: shall I let them in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them alone awhile, and then open the door.</div>
                     <p>Exit Vintner</p>
                     <div class="line">Poins!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter POINS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, Falstaff and the rest of the thieves are at</div>
                     <div class="line">the door: shall we be merry?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">As merry as crickets, my lad. But hark ye; what</div>
                     <div class="line">cunning match have you made with this jest of the</div>
                     <div class="line">drawer? come, what's the issue?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I am now of all humours that have showed themselves</div>
                     <div class="line">humours since the old days of goodman Adam to the</div>
                     <div class="line">pupil age of this present twelve o'clock at midnight.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter FRANCIS</p>
                     <div class="line">What's o'clock, Francis?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRANCIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever this fellow should have fewer words than a</div>
                     <div class="line">parrot, and yet the son of a woman! His industry is</div>
                     <div class="line">upstairs and downstairs; his eloquence the parcel of</div>
                     <div class="line">a reckoning. I am not yet of Percy's mind, the</div>
                     <div class="line">Hotspur of the north; he that kills me some six or</div>
                     <div class="line">seven dozen of Scots at a breakfast, washes his</div>
                     <div class="line">hands, and says to his wife 'Fie upon this quiet</div>
                     <div class="line">life! I want work.' 'O my sweet Harry,' says she,</div>
                     <div class="line">'how many hast thou killed to-day?' 'Give my roan</div>
                     <div class="line">horse a drench,' says he; and answers 'Some</div>
                     <div class="line">fourteen,' an hour after; 'a trifle, a trifle.' I</div>
                     <div class="line">prithee, call in Falstaff: I'll play Percy, and</div>
                     <div class="line">that damned brawn shall play Dame Mortimer his</div>
                     <div class="line">wife. 'Rivo!' says the drunkard. Call in ribs, call in tallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FALSTAFF, GADSHILL, BARDOLPH, and PETO;
FRANCIS following with wine</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Jack: where hast thou been?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague of all cowards, I say, and a vengeance too!</div>
                     <div class="line">marry, and amen! Give me a cup of sack, boy. Ere I</div>
                     <div class="line">lead this life long, I'll sew nether stocks and mend</div>
                     <div class="line">them and foot them too. A plague of all cowards!</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me a cup of sack, rogue. Is there no virtue extant?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He drinks</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou never see Titan kiss a dish of butter?</div>
                     <div class="line">pitiful-hearted Titan, that melted at the sweet tale</div>
                     <div class="line">of the sun's! if thou didst, then behold that compound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">You rogue, here's lime in this sack too: there is</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing but roguery to be found in villanous man:</div>
                     <div class="line">yet a coward is worse than a cup of sack with lime</div>
                     <div class="line">in it. A villanous coward! Go thy ways, old Jack;</div>
                     <div class="line">die when thou wilt, if manhood, good manhood, be</div>
                     <div class="line">not forgot upon the face of the earth, then am I a</div>
                     <div class="line">shotten herring. There live not three good men</div>
                     <div class="line">unhanged in England; and one of them is fat and</div>
                     <div class="line">grows old: God help the while! a bad world, I say.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I were a weaver; I could sing psalms or any</div>
                     <div class="line">thing. A plague of all cowards, I say still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, wool-sack! what mutter you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A king's son! If I do not beat thee out of thy</div>
                     <div class="line">kingdom with a dagger of lath, and drive all thy</div>
                     <div class="line">subjects afore thee like a flock of wild-geese,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll never wear hair on my face more. You Prince of Wales!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, you whoreson round man, what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not you a coward? answer me to that: and Poins there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Zounds, ye fat paunch, an ye call me coward, by the</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, I'll stab thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I call thee coward! I'll see thee damned ere I call</div>
                     <div class="line">thee coward: but I would give a thousand pound I</div>
                     <div class="line">could run as fast as thou canst. You are straight</div>
                     <div class="line">enough in the shoulders, you care not who sees your</div>
                     <div class="line">back: call you that backing of your friends? A</div>
                     <div class="line">plague upon such backing! give me them that will</div>
                     <div class="line">face me. Give me a cup of sack: I am a rogue, if I</div>
                     <div class="line">drunk to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">O villain! thy lips are scarce wiped since thou</div>
                     <div class="line">drunkest last.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">All's one for that.</div>
                     <p>He drinks</p>
                     <div class="line">A plague of all cowards, still say I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter! there be four of us here have</div>
                     <div class="line">ta'en a thousand pound this day morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is it, Jack? where is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is it! taken from us it is: a hundred upon</div>
                     <div class="line">poor four of us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, a hundred, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a rogue, if I were not at half-sword with a</div>
                     <div class="line">dozen of them two hours together. I have 'scaped by</div>
                     <div class="line">miracle. I am eight times thrust through the</div>
                     <div class="line">doublet, four through the hose; my buckler cut</div>
                     <div class="line">through and through; my sword hacked like a</div>
                     <div class="line">hand-saw--ecce signum! I never dealt better since</div>
                     <div class="line">I was a man: all would not do. A plague of all</div>
                     <div class="line">cowards! Let them speak: if they speak more or</div>
                     <div class="line">less than truth, they are villains and the sons of darkness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, sirs; how was it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GADSHILL</div>
                     <div class="line">We four set upon some dozen--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Sixteen at least, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
