                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">All furnish'd, all in arms;</div>
                     <div class="line">All plumed like estridges that with the wind</div>
                     <div class="line">Baited like eagles having lately bathed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Glittering in golden coats, like images;</div>
                     <div class="line">As full of spirit as the month of May,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gorgeous as the sun at midsummer;</div>
                     <div class="line">Wanton as youthful goats, wild as young bulls.</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw young Harry, with his beaver on,</div>
                     <div class="line">His cuisses on his thighs, gallantly arm'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Rise from the ground like feather'd Mercury,</div>
                     <div class="line">And vaulted with such ease into his seat,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if an angel dropp'd down from the clouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">To turn and wind a fiery Pegasus</div>
                     <div class="line">And witch the world with noble horsemanship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, no more: worse than the sun in March,</div>
                     <div class="line">This praise doth nourish agues. Let them come:</div>
                     <div class="line">They come like sacrifices in their trim,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the fire-eyed maid of smoky war</div>
                     <div class="line">All hot and bleeding will we offer them:</div>
                     <div class="line">The mailed Mars shall on his altar sit</div>
                     <div class="line">Up to the ears in blood. I am on fire</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear this rich reprisal is so nigh</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet not ours. Come, let me taste my horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is to bear me like a thunderbolt</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the bosom of the Prince of Wales:</div>
                     <div class="line">Harry to Harry shall, hot horse to horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet and ne'er part till one drop down a corse.</div>
                     <div class="line">O that Glendower were come!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">There is more news:</div>
                     <div class="line">I learn'd in Worcester, as I rode along,</div>
                     <div class="line">He cannot draw his power this fourteen days.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's the worst tidings that I hear of yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by my faith, that bears a frosty sound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">What may the king's whole battle reach unto?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">To thirty thousand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Forty let it be:</div>
                     <div class="line">My father and Glendower being both away,</div>
                     <div class="line">The powers of us may serve so great a day</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us take a muster speedily:</div>
                     <div class="line">Doomsday is near; die all, die merrily.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk not of dying: I am out of fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Of death or death's hand for this one-half year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A public road near Coventry.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FALSTAFF and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Bardolph, get thee before to Coventry; fill me a</div>
                     <div class="line">bottle of sack: our soldiers shall march through;</div>
                     <div class="line">we'll to Sutton Co'fil' tonight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you give me money, captain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay out, lay out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">This bottle makes an angel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">An if it do, take it for thy labour; and if it make</div>
                     <div class="line">twenty, take them all; I'll answer the coinage. Bid</div>
                     <div class="line">my lieutenant Peto meet me at town's end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, captain: farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">If I be not ashamed of my soldiers, I am a soused</div>
                     <div class="line">gurnet. I have misused the king's press damnably.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have got, in exchange of a hundred and fifty</div>
                     <div class="line">soldiers, three hundred and odd pounds. I press me</div>
                     <div class="line">none but good house-holders, yeoman's sons; inquire</div>
                     <div class="line">me out contracted bachelors, such as had been asked</div>
                     <div class="line">twice on the banns; such a commodity of warm slaves,</div>
                     <div class="line">as had as lieve hear the devil as a drum; such as</div>
                     <div class="line">fear the report of a caliver worse than a struck</div>
                     <div class="line">fowl or a hurt wild-duck. I pressed me none but such</div>
                     <div class="line">toasts-and-butter, with hearts in their bellies no</div>
                     <div class="line">bigger than pins' heads, and they have bought out</div>
                     <div class="line">their services; and now my whole charge consists of</div>
                     <div class="line">ancients, corporals, lieutenants, gentlemen of</div>
                     <div class="line">companies, slaves as ragged as Lazarus in the</div>
                     <div class="line">painted cloth, where the glutton's dogs licked his</div>
                     <div class="line">sores; and such as indeed were never soldiers, but</div>
                     <div class="line">discarded unjust serving-men, younger sons to</div>
                     <div class="line">younger brothers, revolted tapsters and ostlers</div>
                     <div class="line">trade-fallen, the cankers of a calm world and a</div>
                     <div class="line">long peace, ten times more dishonourable ragged than</div>
                     <div class="line">an old faced ancient: and such have I, to fill up</div>
                     <div class="line">the rooms of them that have bought out their</div>
                     <div class="line">services, that you would think that I had a hundred</div>
                     <div class="line">and fifty tattered prodigals lately come from</div>
                     <div class="line">swine-keeping, from eating draff and husks. A mad</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow met me on the way and told me I had unloaded</div>
                     <div class="line">all the gibbets and pressed the dead bodies. No eye</div>
                     <div class="line">hath seen such scarecrows. I'll not march through</div>
                     <div class="line">Coventry with them, that's flat: nay, and the</div>
                     <div class="line">villains march wide betwixt the legs, as if they had</div>
                     <div class="line">gyves on; for indeed I had the most of them out of</div>
                     <div class="line">prison. There's but a shirt and a half in all my</div>
                     <div class="line">company; and the half shirt is two napkins tacked</div>
                     <div class="line">together and thrown over the shoulders like an</div>
                     <div class="line">herald's coat without sleeves; and the shirt, to say</div>
                     <div class="line">the truth, stolen from my host at Saint Alban's, or</div>
                     <div class="line">the red-nose innkeeper of Daventry. But that's all</div>
                     <div class="line">one; they'll find linen enough on every hedge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCE and WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, blown Jack! how now, quilt!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What, Hal! how now, mad wag! what a devil dost thou</div>
                     <div class="line">in Warwickshire? My good Lord of Westmoreland, I</div>
                     <div class="line">cry you mercy: I thought your honour had already been</div>
                     <div class="line">at Shrewsbury.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, Sir John,'tis more than time that I were</div>
                     <div class="line">there, and you too; but my powers are there already.</div>
                     <div class="line">The king, I can tell you, looks for us all: we must</div>
                     <div class="line">away all night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, never fear me: I am as vigilant as a cat to</div>
                     <div class="line">steal cream.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I think, to steal cream indeed, for thy theft hath</div>
                     <div class="line">already made thee butter. But tell me, Jack, whose</div>
                     <div class="line">fellows are these that come after?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine, Hal, mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I did never see such pitiful rascals.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, tut; good enough to toss; food for powder, food</div>
                     <div class="line">for powder; they'll fill a pit as well as better:</div>
                     <div class="line">tush, man, mortal men, mortal men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but, Sir John, methinks they are exceeding poor</div>
                     <div class="line">and bare, too beggarly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, for their poverty, I know not where they had</div>
                     <div class="line">that; and for their bareness, I am sure they never</div>
                     <div class="line">learned that of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">No I'll be sworn; unless you call three fingers on</div>
                     <div class="line">the ribs bare. But, sirrah, make haste: Percy is</div>
                     <div class="line">already in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is the king encamped?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">He is, Sir John: I fear we shall stay too long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the latter end of a fray and the beginning of a feast</div>
                     <div class="line">Fits a dull fighter and a keen guest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The rebel camp near Shrewsbury.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, DOUGLAS, and VERNON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll fight with him to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It may not be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">You give him then the advantage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a whit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why say you so? looks he not for supply?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">So do we.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">His is certain, ours is doubtful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Good cousin, be advised; stir not tonight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">You do not counsel well:</div>
                     <div class="line">You speak it out of fear and cold heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Do me no slander, Douglas: by my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I dare well maintain it with my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">If well-respected honour bid me on,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold as little counsel with weak fear</div>
                     <div class="line">As you, my lord, or any Scot that this day lives:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be seen to-morrow in the battle</div>
                     <div class="line">Which of us fears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, or to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">To-night, say I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come it nay not be. I wonder much,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being men of such great leading as you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you foresee not what impediments</div>
                     <div class="line">Drag back our expedition: certain horse</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my cousin Vernon's are not yet come up:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your uncle Worcester's horse came but today;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now their pride and mettle is asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their courage with hard labour tame and dull,</div>
                     <div class="line">That not a horse is half the half of himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">So are the horses of the enemy</div>
                     <div class="line">In general, journey-bated and brought low:</div>
                     <div class="line">The better part of ours are full of rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The number of the king exceedeth ours:</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's sake. cousin, stay till all come in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The trumpet sounds a parley</p>
               <p>Enter SIR WALTER BLUNT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">I come with gracious offers from the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">if you vouchsafe me hearing and respect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Sir Walter Blunt; and would to God</div>
                     <div class="line">You were of our determination!</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of us love you well; and even those some</div>
                     <div class="line">Envy your great deservings and good name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because you are not of our quality,</div>
                     <div class="line">But stand against us like an enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">And God defend but still I should stand so,</div>
                     <div class="line">So long as out of limit and true rule</div>
                     <div class="line">You stand against anointed majesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">But to my charge. The king hath sent to know</div>
                     <div class="line">The nature of your griefs, and whereupon</div>
                     <div class="line">You conjure from the breast of civil peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Such bold hostility, teaching his duteous land</div>
                     <div class="line">Audacious cruelty. If that the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Have any way your good deserts forgot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he confesseth to be manifold,</div>
                     <div class="line">He bids you name your griefs; and with all speed</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall have your desires with interest</div>
                     <div class="line">And pardon absolute for yourself and these</div>
                     <div class="line">Herein misled by your suggestion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">The king is kind; and well we know the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Knows at what time to promise, when to pay.</div>
                     <div class="line">My father and my uncle and myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Did give him that same royalty he wears;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when he was not six and twenty strong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sick in the world's regard, wretched and low,</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor unminded outlaw sneaking home,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father gave him welcome to the shore;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when he heard him swear and vow to God</div>
                     <div class="line">He came but to be Duke of Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sue his livery and beg his peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">With tears of innocency and terms of zeal,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father, in kind heart and pity moved,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swore him assistance and perform'd it too.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now when the lords and barons of the realm</div>
                     <div class="line">Perceived Northumberland did lean to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">The more and less came in with cap and knee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Met him in boroughs, cities, villages,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attended him on bridges, stood in lanes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Laid gifts before him, proffer'd him their oaths,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave him their heirs, as pages follow'd him</div>
                     <div class="line">Even at the heels in golden multitudes.</div>
                     <div class="line">He presently, as greatness knows itself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Steps me a little higher than his vow</div>
                     <div class="line">Made to my father, while his blood was poor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the naked shore at Ravenspurgh;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now, forsooth, takes on him to reform</div>
                     <div class="line">Some certain edicts and some strait decrees</div>
                     <div class="line">That lie too heavy on the commonwealth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries out upon abuses, seems to weep</div>
                     <div class="line">Over his country's wrongs; and by this face,</div>
                     <div class="line">This seeming brow of justice, did he win</div>
                     <div class="line">The hearts of all that he did angle for;</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceeded further; cut me off the heads</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all the favourites that the absent king</div>
                     <div class="line">In deputation left behind him here,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he was personal in the Irish war.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, I came not to hear this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to the point.</div>
                     <div class="line">In short time after, he deposed the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">Soon after that, deprived him of his life;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the neck of that, task'd the whole state:</div>
                     <div class="line">To make that worse, suffer'd his kinsman March,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is, if every owner were well placed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed his king, to be engaged in Wales,</div>
                     <div class="line">There without ransom to lie forfeited;</div>
                     <div class="line">Disgraced me in my happy victories,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sought to entrap me by intelligence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rated mine uncle from the council-board;</div>
                     <div class="line">In rage dismiss'd my father from the court;</div>
                     <div class="line">Broke oath on oath, committed wrong on wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in conclusion drove us to seek out</div>
                     <div class="line">This head of safety; and withal to pry</div>
                     <div class="line">Into his title, the which we find</div>
                     <div class="line">Too indirect for long continuance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I return this answer to the king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, Sir Walter: we'll withdraw awhile.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to the king; and let there be impawn'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Some surety for a safe return again,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the morning early shall my uncle</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring him our purposes: and so farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">I would you would accept of grace and love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">And may be so we shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray God you do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK and SIR MICHAEL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Hie, good Sir Michael; bear this sealed brief</div>
                     <div class="line">With winged haste to the lord marshal;</div>
                     <div class="line">This to my cousin Scroop, and all the rest</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom they are directed. If you knew</div>
                     <div class="line">How much they do to import, you would make haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">My good lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I guess their tenor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Like enough you do.</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, good Sir Michael, is a day</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein the fortune of ten thousand men</div>
                     <div class="line">Must bide the touch; for, sir, at Shrewsbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I am truly given to understand,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king with mighty and quick-raised power</div>
                     <div class="line">Meets with Lord Harry: and, I fear, Sir Michael,</div>
                     <div class="line">What with the sickness of Northumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose power was in the first proportion,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what with Owen Glendower's absence thence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who with them was a rated sinew too</div>
                     <div class="line">And comes not in, o'er-ruled by prophecies,</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear the power of Percy is too weak</div>
                     <div class="line">To wage an instant trial with the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, my good lord, you need not fear;</div>
                     <div class="line">There is Douglas and Lord Mortimer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Mortimer is not there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">But there is Mordake, Vernon, Lord Harry Percy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there is my Lord of Worcester and a head</div>
                     <div class="line">Of gallant warriors, noble gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">And so there is: but yet the king hath drawn</div>
                     <div class="line">The special head of all the land together:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Prince of Wales, Lord John of Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble Westmoreland and warlike Blunt;</div>
                     <div class="line">And moe corrivals and dear men</div>
                     <div class="line">Of estimation and command in arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt not, my lord, they shall be well opposed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope no less, yet needful 'tis to fear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to prevent the worst, Sir Michael, speed:</div>
                     <div class="line">For if Lord Percy thrive not, ere the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Dismiss his power, he means to visit us,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he hath heard of our confederacy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'tis but wisdom to make strong against him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore make haste. I must go write again</div>
                     <div class="line">To other friends; and so farewell, Sir Michael.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  The rebel camp.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY, PRINCE HENRY, Lord John of
LANCASTER, EARL OF WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT,
and FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">How bloodily the sun begins to peer</div>
                     <div class="line">Above yon busky hill! the day looks pale</div>
                     <div class="line">At his distemperature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">The southern wind</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth play the trumpet to his purposes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by his hollow whistling in the leaves</div>
                     <div class="line">Foretells a tempest and a blustering day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Then with the losers let it sympathize,</div>
                     <div class="line">For nothing can seem foul to those that win.</div>
                     <p>The trumpet sounds</p>
                     <p>Enter WORCESTER and VERNON</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, my Lord of Worcester! 'tis not well</div>
                     <div class="line">That you and I should meet upon such terms</div>
                     <div class="line">As now we meet. You have deceived our trust,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made us doff our easy robes of peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">To crush our old limbs in ungentle steel:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is not well, my lord, this is not well.</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you to it? will you again unknit</div>
                     <div class="line">This curlish knot of all-abhorred war?</div>
                     <div class="line">And move in that obedient orb again</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you did give a fair and natural light,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be no more an exhaled meteor,</div>
                     <div class="line">A prodigy of fear and a portent</div>
                     <div class="line">Of broached mischief to the unborn times?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, my liege:</div>
                     <div class="line">For mine own part, I could be well content</div>
                     <div class="line">To entertain the lag-end of my life</div>
                     <div class="line">With quiet hours; for I do protest,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not sought the day of this dislike.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">You have not sought it! how comes it, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebellion lay in his way, and he found it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, chewet, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It pleased your majesty to turn your looks</div>
                     <div class="line">Of favour from myself and all our house;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I must remember you, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">We were the first and dearest of your friends.</div>
                     <div class="line">For you my staff of office did I break</div>
                     <div class="line">In Richard's time; and posted day and night</div>
                     <div class="line">to meet you on the way, and kiss your hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">When yet you were in place and in account</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing so strong and fortunate as I.</div>
                     <div class="line">It was myself, my brother and his son,</div>
                     <div class="line">That brought you home and boldly did outdare</div>
                     <div class="line">The dangers of the time. You swore to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you did swear that oath at Doncaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you did nothing purpose 'gainst the state;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor claim no further than your new-fall'n right,</div>
                     <div class="line">The seat of Gaunt, dukedom of Lancaster:</div>
                     <div class="line">To this we swore our aid. But in short space</div>
                     <div class="line">It rain'd down fortune showering on your head;</div>
                     <div class="line">And such a flood of greatness fell on you,</div>
                     <div class="line">What with our help, what with the absent king,</div>
                     <div class="line">What with the injuries of a wanton time,</div>
                     <div class="line">The seeming sufferances that you had borne,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the contrarious winds that held the king</div>
                     <div class="line">So long in his unlucky Irish wars</div>
                     <div class="line">That all in England did repute him dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">And from this swarm of fair advantages</div>
                     <div class="line">You took occasion to be quickly woo'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To gripe the general sway into your hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">Forget your oath to us at Doncaster;</div>
                     <div class="line">And being fed by us you used us so</div>
                     <div class="line">As that ungentle hull, the cuckoo's bird,</div>
                     <div class="line">Useth the sparrow; did oppress our nest;</div>
                     <div class="line">Grew by our feeding to so great a bulk</div>
                     <div class="line">That even our love durst not come near your sight</div>
                     <div class="line">For fear of swallowing; but with nimble wing</div>
                     <div class="line">We were enforced, for safety sake, to fly</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of sight and raise this present head;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereby we stand opposed by such means</div>
                     <div class="line">As you yourself have forged against yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">By unkind usage, dangerous countenance,</div>
                     <div class="line">And violation of all faith and troth</div>
                     <div class="line">Sworn to us in your younger enterprise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">These things indeed you have articulate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proclaim'd at market-crosses, read in churches,</div>
                     <div class="line">To face the garment of rebellion</div>
                     <div class="line">With some fine colour that may please the eye</div>
                     <div class="line">Of fickle changelings and poor discontents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which gape and rub the elbow at the news</div>
                     <div class="line">Of hurlyburly innovation:</div>
                     <div class="line">And never yet did insurrection want</div>
                     <div class="line">Such water-colours to impaint his cause;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor moody beggars, starving for a time</div>
                     <div class="line">Of pellmell havoc and confusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">In both your armies there is many a soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall pay full dearly for this encounter,</div>
                     <div class="line">If once they join in trial. Tell your nephew,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Prince of Wales doth join with all the world</div>
                     <div class="line">In praise of Henry Percy: by my hopes,</div>
                     <div class="line">This present enterprise set off his head,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not think a braver gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">More active-valiant or more valiant-young,</div>
                     <div class="line">More daring or more bold, is now alive</div>
                     <div class="line">To grace this latter age with noble deeds.</div>
                     <div class="line">For my part, I may speak it to my shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a truant been to chivalry;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so I hear he doth account me too;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet this before my father's majesty--</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content that he shall take the odds</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his great name and estimation,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will, to save the blood on either side,</div>
                     <div class="line">Try fortune with him in a single fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Prince of Wales, so dare we venture thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit considerations infinite</div>
                     <div class="line">Do make against it. No, good Worcester, no,</div>
                     <div class="line">We love our people well; even those we love</div>
                     <div class="line">That are misled upon your cousin's part;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, will they take the offer of our grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both he and they and you, every man</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be my friend again and I'll be his:</div>
                     <div class="line">So tell your cousin, and bring me word</div>
                     <div class="line">What he will do: but if he will not yield,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebuke and dread correction wait on us</div>
                     <div class="line">And they shall do their office. So, be gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">We will not now be troubled with reply:</div>
                     <div class="line">We offer fair; take it advisedly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt WORCESTER and VERNON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">It will not be accepted, on my life:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Douglas and the Hotspur both together</div>
                     <div class="line">Are confident against the world in arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, therefore, every leader to his charge;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, on their answer, will we set on them:</div>
                     <div class="line">And God befriend us, as our cause is just!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but PRINCE HENRY and FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Hal, if thou see me down in the battle and bestride</div>
                     <div class="line">me, so; 'tis a point of friendship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but a colossus can do thee that friendship.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say thy prayers, and farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I  would 'twere bed-time, Hal, and all well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thou owest God a death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit PRINCE HENRY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not due yet; I would be loath to pay him before</div>
                     <div class="line">his day. What need I be so forward with him that</div>
                     <div class="line">calls not on me? Well, 'tis no matter; honour pricks</div>
                     <div class="line">me on. Yea, but how if honour prick me off when I</div>
                     <div class="line">come on? how then? Can honour set to a leg? no: or</div>
                     <div class="line">an arm? no: or take away the grief of a wound? no.</div>
                     <div class="line">Honour hath no skill in surgery, then? no. What is</div>
                     <div class="line">honour? a word. What is in that word honour? what</div>
                     <div class="line">is that honour? air. A trim reckoning! Who hath it?</div>
                     <div class="line">he that died o' Wednesday. Doth he feel it? no.</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth he hear it? no. 'Tis insensible, then. Yea,</div>
                     <div class="line">to the dead. But will it not live with the living?</div>
                     <div class="line">no. Why? detraction will not suffer it. Therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll none of it. Honour is a mere scutcheon: and so</div>
                     <div class="line">ends my catechism.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The rebel camp.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter WORCESTER and VERNON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, no, my nephew must not know, Sir Richard,</div>
                     <div class="line">The liberal and kind offer of the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere best he did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Then are we all undone.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not possible, it cannot be,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king should keep his word in loving us;</div>
                     <div class="line">He will suspect us still and find a time</div>
                     <div class="line">To punish this offence in other faults:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suspicion all our lives shall be stuck full of eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">For treason is but trusted like the fox,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, ne'er so tame, so cherish'd and lock'd up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will have a wild trick of his ancestors.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look how we can, or sad or merrily,</div>
                     <div class="line">Interpretation will misquote our looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we shall feed like oxen at a stall,</div>
                     <div class="line">The better cherish'd, still the nearer death.</div>
                     <div class="line">My nephew's trespass may be well forgot;</div>
                     <div class="line">it hath the excuse of youth and heat of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And an adopted name of privilege,</div>
                     <div class="line">A hair-brain'd Hotspur, govern'd by a spleen:</div>
                     <div class="line">All his offences live upon my head</div>
                     <div class="line">And on his father's; we did train him on,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, his corruption being ta'en from us,</div>
                     <div class="line">We, as the spring of all, shall pay for all.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, good cousin, let not Harry know,</div>
                     <div class="line">In any case, the offer of the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver what you will; I'll say 'tis so.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes your cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HOTSPUR and DOUGLAS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">My uncle is return'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver up my Lord of Westmoreland.</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The king will bid you battle presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Defy him by the Lord of Westmoreland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Douglas, go you and tell him so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and shall, and very willingly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no seeming mercy in the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you beg any? God forbid!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I told him gently of our grievances,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his oath-breaking; which he mended thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">By now forswearing that he is forsworn:</div>
                     <div class="line">He calls us rebels, traitors; and will scourge</div>
                     <div class="line">With haughty arms this hateful name in us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter the EARL OF DOUGLAS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm, gentlemen; to arms! for I have thrown</div>
                     <div class="line">A brave defiance in King Henry's teeth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Westmoreland, that was engaged, did bear it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which cannot choose but bring him quickly on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The Prince of Wales stepp'd forth before the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, nephew, challenged you to single fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, would the quarrel lay upon our heads,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that no man might draw short breath today</div>
                     <div class="line">But I and Harry Monmouth! Tell me, tell me,</div>
                     <div class="line">How show'd his tasking? seem'd it in contempt?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by my soul; I never in my life</div>
                     <div class="line">Did hear a challenge urged more modestly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless a brother should a brother dare</div>
                     <div class="line">To gentle exercise and proof of arms.</div>
                     <div class="line">He gave you all the duties of a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">Trimm'd up your praises with a princely tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spoke to your deservings like a chronicle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making you ever better than his praise</div>
                     <div class="line">By still dispraising praise valued in you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, which became him like a prince indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">He made a blushing cital of himself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And chid his truant youth with such a grace</div>
                     <div class="line">As if he master'd there a double spirit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Of teaching and of learning instantly.</div>
                     <div class="line">There did he pause: but let me tell the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he outlive the envy of this day,</div>
                     <div class="line">England did never owe so sweet a hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">So much misconstrued in his wantonness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, I think thou art enamoured</div>
                     <div class="line">On his follies: never did I hear</div>
                     <div class="line">Of any prince so wild a libertine.</div>
                     <div class="line">But be he as he will, yet once ere night</div>
                     <div class="line">I will embrace him with a soldier's arm,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he shall shrink under my courtesy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm, arm with speed: and, fellows, soldiers, friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Better consider what you have to do</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I, that have not well the gift of tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Can lift your blood up with persuasion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, here are letters for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot read them now.</div>
                     <div class="line">O gentlemen, the time of life is short!</div>
                     <div class="line">To spend that shortness basely were too long,</div>
                     <div class="line">If life did ride upon a dial's point,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still ending at the arrival of an hour.</div>
                     <div class="line">An if we live, we live to tread on kings;</div>
                     <div class="line">If die, brave death, when princes die with us!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, for our consciences, the arms are fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the intent of bearing them is just.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter another Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, prepare; the king comes on apace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank him, that he cuts me from my tale,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I profess not talking; only this--</div>
                     <div class="line">Let each man do his best: and here draw I</div>
                     <div class="line">A sword, whose temper I intend to stain</div>
                     <div class="line">With the best blood that I can meet withal</div>
                     <div class="line">In the adventure of this perilous day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Esperance! Percy! and set on.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound all the lofty instruments of war,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by that music let us all embrace;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, heaven to earth, some of us never shall</div>
                     <div class="line">A second time do such a courtesy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The trumpets sound. They embrace, and exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>KING HENRY enters with his power. Alarum to the
battle. Then enter DOUGLAS and SIR WALTER BLUNT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">What is thy name, that in the battle thus</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou crossest me? what honour dost thou seek</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my head?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Know then, my name is Douglas;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do haunt thee in the battle thus</div>
                     <div class="line">Because some tell me that thou art a king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">They tell thee true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lord of Stafford dear to-day hath bought</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy likeness, for instead of thee, King Harry,</div>
                     <div class="line">This sword hath ended him: so shall it thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless thou yield thee as my prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR WALTER BLUNT</div>
                     <div class="line">I was not born a yielder, thou proud Scot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt find a king that will revenge</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Stafford's death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They fight. DOUGLAS kills SIR WALTER BLUNT.
Enter HOTSPUR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O Douglas, hadst thou fought at Holmedon thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">never had triumph'd upon a Scot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">All's done, all's won; here breathless lies the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">This, Douglas? no: I know this face full well:</div>
                     <div class="line">A gallant knight he was, his name was Blunt;</div>
                     <div class="line">Semblably furnish'd like the king himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes!</div>
                     <div class="line">A borrow'd title hast thou bought too dear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why didst thou tell me that thou wert a king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">The king hath many marching in his coats.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EARL OF DOUGLAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my sword, I will kill all his coats;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll murder all his wardrobe, piece by piece,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until I meet the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Up, and away!</div>
                     <div class="line">Our soldiers stand full fairly for the day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Alarum. Enter FALSTAFF, solus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I could 'scape shot-free at London, I fear</div>
                     <div class="line">the shot here; here's no scoring but upon the pate.</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! who are you? Sir Walter Blunt: there's honour</div>
                     <div class="line">for you! here's no vanity! I am as hot as moulten</div>
                     <div class="line">lead, and as heavy too: God keep lead out of me! I</div>
                     <div class="line">need no more weight than mine own bowels. I have</div>
                     <div class="line">led my ragamuffins where they are peppered: there's</div>
                     <div class="line">not three of my hundred and fifty left alive; and</div>
                     <div class="line">they are for the town's end, to beg during life.</div>
                     <div class="line">But who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PRINCE HENRY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, stand'st thou idle here? lend me thy sword:</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a nobleman lies stark and stiff</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the hoofs of vaunting enemies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose deaths are yet unrevenged: I prithee,</div>
                     <div class="line">lend me thy sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">O Hal, I prithee, give me leave to breathe awhile.</div>
                     <div class="line">Turk Gregory never did such deeds in arms as I have</div>
                     <div class="line">done this day. I have paid Percy, I have made him sure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">He is, indeed; and living to kill thee. I prithee,</div>
                     <div class="line">lend me thy sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, before God, Hal, if Percy be alive, thou get'st</div>
                     <div class="line">not my sword; but take my pistol, if thou wilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Give it to me: what, is it in the case?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Hal; 'tis hot, 'tis hot; there's that will sack a city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>PRINCE HENRY draws it out, and finds it to be a
bottle of sack</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is it a time to jest and dally now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He throws the bottle at him. Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, if Percy be alive, I'll pierce him. If he do</div>
                     <div class="line">come in my way, so: if he do not, if I come in his</div>
                     <div class="line">willingly, let him make a carbonado of me. I like</div>
                     <div class="line">not such grinning honour as Sir Walter hath: give me</div>
                     <div class="line">life: which if I can save, so; if not, honour comes</div>
                     <div class="line">unlooked for, and there's an end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit FALSTAFF</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Excursions. Enter PRINCE HENRY, LORD JOHN
OF LANCASTER, and EARL OF WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Harry, withdraw thyself; thou bleed'st too much.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord John of Lancaster, go you with him.</div>
