                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, do you see these meteors? do you behold</div>
                              <div class="line">these exhalations?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">What think you they portend?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Hot livers and cold purses.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Choler, my lord, if rightly taken.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">No, if rightly taken, halter.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter FALSTAFF</p>
                              <div class="line">Here comes lean Jack, here comes bare-bone.</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my sweet creature of bombast!</div>
                              <div class="line">How long is't ago, Jack, since thou sawest thine own knee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My own knee! when I was about thy years, Hal, I was</div>
                              <div class="line">not an eagle's talon in the waist; I could have</div>
                              <div class="line">crept into any alderman's thumb-ring: a plague of</div>
                              <div class="line">sighing and grief! it blows a man up like a</div>
                              <div class="line">bladder. There's villanous news abroad: here was</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John Bracy from your father; you must to the</div>
                              <div class="line">court in the morning. That same mad fellow of the</div>
                              <div class="line">north, Percy, and he of Wales, that gave Amamon the</div>
                              <div class="line">bastinado and made Lucifer cuckold and swore the</div>
                              <div class="line">devil his true liegeman upon the cross of a Welsh</div>
                              <div class="line">hook--what a plague call you him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, Glendower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Owen, Owen, the same; and his son-in-law Mortimer,</div>
                              <div class="line">and old Northumberland, and that sprightly Scot of</div>
                              <div class="line">Scots, Douglas, that runs o' horseback up a hill</div>
                              <div class="line">perpendicular,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">He that rides at high speed and with his pistol</div>
                              <div class="line">kills a sparrow flying.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">You have hit it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">So did he never the sparrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, that rascal hath good mettle in him; he will not run.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what a rascal art thou then, to praise him so</div>
                              <div class="line">for running!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">O' horseback, ye cuckoo; but afoot he will not budge a foot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, Jack, upon instinct.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I grant ye, upon instinct. Well, he is there too,</div>
                              <div class="line">and one Mordake, and a thousand blue-caps more:</div>
                              <div class="line">Worcester is stolen away to-night; thy father's</div>
                              <div class="line">beard is turned white with the news: you may buy</div>
                              <div class="line">land now as cheap as stinking mackerel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, it is like, if there come a hot June and</div>
                              <div class="line">this civil buffeting hold, we shall buy maidenheads</div>
                              <div class="line">as they buy hob-nails, by the hundreds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">By the mass, lad, thou sayest true; it is like we</div>
                              <div class="line">shall have good trading that way. But tell me, Hal,</div>
                              <div class="line">art not thou horrible afeard? thou being</div>
                              <div class="line">heir-apparent, could the world pick thee out three</div>
                              <div class="line">such enemies again as that fiend Douglas, that</div>
                              <div class="line">spirit Percy, and that devil Glendower? Art thou</div>
                              <div class="line">not horribly afraid? doth not thy blood thrill at</div>
                              <div class="line">it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a whit, i' faith; I lack some of thy instinct.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, thou wert be horribly chid tomorrow when thou</div>
                              <div class="line">comest to thy father: if thou love me, practise an answer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Do thou stand for my father, and examine me upon the</div>
                              <div class="line">particulars of my life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I? content: this chair shall be my state,</div>
                              <div class="line">this dagger my sceptre, and this cushion my crown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy state is taken for a joined-stool, thy golden</div>
                              <div class="line">sceptre for a leaden dagger, and thy precious rich</div>
                              <div class="line">crown for a pitiful bald crown!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, an the fire of grace be not quite out of thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">now shalt thou be moved. Give me a cup of sack to</div>
                              <div class="line">make my eyes look red, that it may be thought I have</div>
                              <div class="line">wept; for I must speak in passion, and I will do it</div>
                              <div class="line">in King Cambyses' vein.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, here is my leg.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">And here is my speech. Stand aside, nobility.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                              <div class="line">O Jesu, this is excellent sport, i' faith!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Weep not, sweet queen; for trickling tears are vain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                              <div class="line">O, the father, how he holds his countenance!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">For God's sake, lords, convey my tristful queen;</div>
                              <div class="line">For tears do stop the flood-gates of her eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                              <div class="line">O Jesu, he doth it as like one of these harlotry</div>
                              <div class="line">players as ever I see!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, good pint-pot; peace, good tickle-brain.</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry, I do not only marvel where thou spendest thy</div>
                              <div class="line">time, but also how thou art accompanied: for though</div>
                              <div class="line">the camomile, the more it is trodden on the faster</div>
                              <div class="line">it grows, yet youth, the more it is wasted the</div>
                              <div class="line">sooner it wears. That thou art my son, I have</div>
                              <div class="line">partly thy mother's word, partly my own opinion,</div>
                              <div class="line">but chiefly a villanous trick of thine eye and a</div>
                              <div class="line">foolish-hanging of thy nether lip, that doth warrant</div>
                              <div class="line">me. If then thou be son to me, here lies the point;</div>
                              <div class="line">why, being son to me, art thou so pointed at? Shall</div>
                              <div class="line">the blessed sun of heaven prove a micher and eat</div>
                              <div class="line">blackberries? a question not to be asked. Shall</div>
                              <div class="line">the sun of England prove a thief and take purses? a</div>
                              <div class="line">question to be asked. There is a thing, Harry,</div>
                              <div class="line">which thou hast often heard of and it is known to</div>
                              <div class="line">many in our land by the name of pitch: this pitch,</div>
                              <div class="line">as ancient writers do report, doth defile; so doth</div>
                              <div class="line">the company thou keepest: for, Harry, now I do not</div>
                              <div class="line">speak to thee in drink but in tears, not in</div>
                              <div class="line">pleasure but in passion, not in words only, but in</div>
                              <div class="line">woes also: and yet there is a virtuous man whom I</div>
                              <div class="line">have often noted in thy company, but I know not his name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">What manner of man, an it like your majesty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">A goodly portly man, i' faith, and a corpulent; of a</div>
                              <div class="line">cheerful look, a pleasing eye and a most noble</div>
                              <div class="line">carriage; and, as I think, his age some fifty, or,</div>
                              <div class="line">by'r lady, inclining to three score; and now I</div>
                              <div class="line">remember me, his name is Falstaff: if that man</div>
                              <div class="line">should be lewdly given, he deceiveth me; for, Harry,</div>
                              <div class="line">I see virtue in his looks. If then the tree may be</div>
                              <div class="line">known by the fruit, as the fruit by the tree, then,</div>
                              <div class="line">peremptorily I speak it, there is virtue in that</div>
                              <div class="line">Falstaff: him keep with, the rest banish. And tell</div>
                              <div class="line">me now, thou naughty varlet, tell me, where hast</div>
                              <div class="line">thou been this month?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou speak like a king? Do thou stand for me,</div>
                              <div class="line">and I'll play my father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Depose me? if thou dost it half so gravely, so</div>
                              <div class="line">majestically, both in word and matter, hang me up by</div>
                              <div class="line">the heels for a rabbit-sucker or a poulter's hare.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, here I am set.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">And here I stand: judge, my masters.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Harry, whence come you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble lord, from Eastcheap.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">The complaints I hear of thee are grievous.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">'Sblood, my lord, they are false: nay, I'll tickle</div>
                              <div class="line">ye for a young prince, i' faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Swearest thou, ungracious boy? henceforth ne'er look</div>
                              <div class="line">on me. Thou art violently carried away from grace:</div>
                              <div class="line">there is a devil haunts thee in the likeness of an</div>
                              <div class="line">old fat man; a tun of man is thy companion. Why</div>
                              <div class="line">dost thou converse with that trunk of humours, that</div>
                              <div class="line">bolting-hutch of beastliness, that swollen parcel</div>
                              <div class="line">of dropsies, that huge bombard of sack, that stuffed</div>
                              <div class="line">cloak-bag of guts, that roasted Manningtree ox with</div>
                              <div class="line">the pudding in his belly, that reverend vice, that</div>
                              <div class="line">grey iniquity, that father ruffian, that vanity in</div>
                              <div class="line">years? Wherein is he good, but to taste sack and</div>
                              <div class="line">drink it? wherein neat and cleanly, but to carve a</div>
                              <div class="line">capon and eat it? wherein cunning, but in craft?</div>
                              <div class="line">wherein crafty, but in villany? wherein villanous,</div>
                              <div class="line">but in all things? wherein worthy, but in nothing?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I would your grace would take me with you: whom</div>
                              <div class="line">means your grace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">That villanous abominable misleader of youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Falstaff, that old white-bearded Satan.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, the man I know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thou dost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">But to say I know more harm in him than in myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">were to say more than I know. That he is old, the</div>
                              <div class="line">more the pity, his white hairs do witness it; but</div>
                              <div class="line">that he is, saving your reverence, a whoremaster,</div>
                              <div class="line">that I utterly deny. If sack and sugar be a fault,</div>
                              <div class="line">God help the wicked! if to be old and merry be a</div>
                              <div class="line">sin, then many an old host that I know is damned: if</div>
                              <div class="line">to be fat be to be hated, then Pharaoh's lean kine</div>
                              <div class="line">are to be loved. No, my good lord; banish Peto,</div>
                              <div class="line">banish Bardolph, banish Poins: but for sweet Jack</div>
                              <div class="line">Falstaff, kind Jack Falstaff, true Jack Falstaff,</div>
                              <div class="line">valiant Jack Falstaff, and therefore more valiant,</div>
                              <div class="line">being, as he is, old Jack Falstaff, banish not him</div>
                              <div class="line">thy Harry's company, banish not him thy Harry's</div>
                              <div class="line">company: banish plump Jack, and banish all the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I do, I will.</div>
                              <p>A knocking heard</p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Hostess, FRANCIS, and BARDOLPH</p>
                        <p>Re-enter BARDOLPH, running</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">O, my lord, my lord! the sheriff with a most</div>
                              <div class="line">monstrous watch is at the door.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, ye rogue! Play out the play: I have much to</div>
                              <div class="line">say in the behalf of that Falstaff.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter the Hostess</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                              <div class="line">O Jesu, my lord, my lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Heigh, heigh! the devil rides upon a fiddlestick:</div>
                              <div class="line">what's the matter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Hostess</div>
                              <div class="line">The sheriff and all the watch are at the door: they</div>
                              <div class="line">are come to search the house. Shall I let them in?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou hear, Hal? never call a true piece of</div>
                              <div class="line">gold a counterfeit: thou art essentially mad,</div>
                              <div class="line">without seeming so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou a natural coward, without instinct.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I deny your major: if you will deny the sheriff,</div>
                              <div class="line">so; if not, let him enter: if I become not a cart</div>
                              <div class="line">as well as another man, a plague on my bringing up!</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope I shall as soon be strangled with a halter as another.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, hide thee behind the arras: the rest walk up</div>
                              <div class="line">above. Now, my masters, for a true face and good</div>
                              <div class="line">conscience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Both which I have had: but their date is out, and</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore I'll hide me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Call in the sheriff.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all except PRINCE HENRY and PETO</p>
                              <p>Enter Sheriff and the Carrier</p>
                              <div class="line">Now, master sheriff, what is your will with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">First, pardon me, my lord. A hue and cry</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath follow'd certain men unto this house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">What men?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">One of them is well known, my gracious lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">A gross fat man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Carrier</div>
                              <div class="line">As fat as butter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">The man, I do assure you, is not here;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I myself at this time have employ'd him.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, sheriff, I will engage my word to thee</div>
                              <div class="line">That I will, by to-morrow dinner-time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Send him to answer thee, or any man,</div>
                              <div class="line">For any thing he shall be charged withal:</div>
                              <div class="line">And so let me entreat you leave the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, my lord. There are two gentlemen</div>
                              <div class="line">Have in this robbery lost three hundred marks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">It may be so: if he have robb'd these men,</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall be answerable; and so farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">Good night, my noble lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I think it is good morrow, is it not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, my lord, I think it be two o'clock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Sheriff and Carrier</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">This oily rascal is known as well as Paul's. Go,</div>
                              <div class="line">call him forth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                              <div class="line">Falstaff!--Fast asleep behind the arras, and</div>
                              <div class="line">snorting like a horse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark, how hard he fetches breath. Search his pockets.</div>
                              <p>He searcheth his pockets, and findeth certain papers</p>
                              <div class="line">What hast thou found?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing but papers, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's see what they be: read them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  Item, A capon,. . 2s. 2d.</div>
                              <div class="line">Item, Sauce,. . . 4d.</div>
                              <div class="line">Item, Sack, two gallons, 5s. 8d.</div>
                              <div class="line">Item, Anchovies and sack after supper, 2s. 6d.</div>
                              <div class="line">Item, Bread,        ob.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">O monstrous! but one half-penny-worth of bread to</div>
                              <div class="line">this intolerable deal of sack! What there is else,</div>
                              <div class="line">keep close; we'll read it at more advantage: there</div>
                              <div class="line">let him sleep till day. I'll to the court in the</div>
                              <div class="line">morning. We must all to the wars, and thy place</div>
                              <div class="line">shall be honourable. I'll procure this fat rogue a</div>
                              <div class="line">charge of foot; and I know his death will be a</div>
                              <div class="line">march of twelve-score. The money shall be paid</div>
                              <div class="line">back again with advantage. Be with me betimes in</div>
                              <div class="line">the morning; and so, good morrow, Peto.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, good my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, MORTIMER, and GLENDOWER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">These promises are fair, the parties sure,</div>
                              <div class="line">And our induction full of prosperous hope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Mortimer, and cousin Glendower,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you sit down?</div>
                              <div class="line">And uncle Worcester: a plague upon it!</div>
                              <div class="line">I have forgot the map.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">No, here it is.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit, cousin Percy; sit, good cousin Hotspur,</div>
                              <div class="line">For by that name as oft as Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth speak of you, his cheek looks pale and with</div>
                              <div class="line">A rising sigh he wisheth you in heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">And you in hell, as oft as he hears Owen Glendower spoke of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot blame him: at my nativity</div>
                              <div class="line">The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of burning cressets; and at my birth</div>
                              <div class="line">The frame and huge foundation of the earth</div>
                              <div class="line">Shaked like a coward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so it would have done at the same season, if</div>
                              <div class="line">your mother's cat had but kittened, though yourself</div>
                              <div class="line">had never been born.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">I say the earth did shake when I was born.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">And I say the earth was not of my mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you suppose as fearing you it shook.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">The heavens were all on fire, the earth did tremble.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">O, then the earth shook to see the heavens on fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not in fear of your nativity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth</div>
                              <div class="line">In strange eruptions; oft the teeming earth</div>
                              <div class="line">Is with a kind of colic pinch'd and vex'd</div>
                              <div class="line">By the imprisoning of unruly wind</div>
                              <div class="line">Within her womb; which, for enlargement striving,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shakes the old beldam earth and topples down</div>
                              <div class="line">Steeples and moss-grown towers. At your birth</div>
                              <div class="line">Our grandam earth, having this distemperature,</div>
                              <div class="line">In passion shook.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Cousin, of many men</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not bear these crossings. Give me leave</div>
                              <div class="line">To tell you once again that at my birth</div>
                              <div class="line">The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,</div>
                              <div class="line">The goats ran from the mountains, and the herds</div>
                              <div class="line">Were strangely clamorous to the frighted fields.</div>
                              <div class="line">These signs have mark'd me extraordinary;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the courses of my life do show</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not in the roll of common men.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is he living, clipp'd in with the sea</div>
                              <div class="line">That chides the banks of England, Scotland, Wales,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which calls me pupil, or hath read to me?</div>
                              <div class="line">And bring him out that is but woman's son</div>
                              <div class="line">Can trace me in the tedious ways of art</div>
                              <div class="line">And hold me pace in deep experiments.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">I think there's no man speaks better Welsh.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to dinner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, cousin Percy; you will make him mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">I can call spirits from the vasty deep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so can I, or so can any man;</div>
                              <div class="line">But will they come when you do call for them?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, I can teach you, cousin, to command</div>
                              <div class="line">The devil.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">And I can teach thee, coz, to shame the devil</div>
                              <div class="line">By telling truth: tell truth and shame the devil.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou have power to raise him, bring him hither,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll be sworn I have power to shame him hence.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, while you live, tell truth and shame the devil!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, no more of this unprofitable chat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Three times hath Henry Bolingbroke made head</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my power; thrice from the banks of Wye</div>
                              <div class="line">And sandy-bottom'd Severn have I sent him</div>
                              <div class="line">Bootless home and weather-beaten back.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Home without boots, and in foul weather too!</div>
                              <div class="line">How 'scapes he agues, in the devil's name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, here's the map: shall we divide our right</div>
                              <div class="line">According to our threefold order ta'en?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">The archdeacon hath divided it</div>
                              <div class="line">Into three limits very equally:</div>
                              <div class="line">England, from Trent and Severn hitherto,</div>
                              <div class="line">By south and east is to my part assign'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">All westward, Wales beyond the Severn shore,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the fertile land within that bound,</div>
                              <div class="line">To Owen Glendower: and, dear coz, to you</div>
                              <div class="line">The remnant northward, lying off from Trent.</div>
                              <div class="line">And our indentures tripartite are drawn;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which being sealed interchangeably,</div>
                              <div class="line">A business that this night may execute,</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow, cousin Percy, you and I</div>
                              <div class="line">And my good Lord of Worcester will set forth</div>
                              <div class="line">To meet your father and the Scottish power,</div>
                              <div class="line">As is appointed us, at Shrewsbury.</div>
                              <div class="line">My father Glendower is not ready yet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not shall we need his help these fourteen days.</div>
                              <div class="line">Within that space you may have drawn together</div>
                              <div class="line">Your tenants, friends and neighbouring gentlemen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">A shorter time shall send me to you, lords:</div>
                              <div class="line">And in my conduct shall your ladies come;</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom you now must steal and take no leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">For there will be a world of water shed</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the parting of your wives and you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks my moiety, north from Burton here,</div>
                              <div class="line">In quantity equals not one of yours:</div>
                              <div class="line">See how this river comes me cranking in,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cuts me from the best of all my land</div>
                              <div class="line">A huge half-moon, a monstrous cantle out.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have the current in this place damm'd up;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here the smug and silver Trent shall run</div>
                              <div class="line">In a new channel, fair and evenly;</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall not wind with such a deep indent,</div>
                              <div class="line">To rob me of so rich a bottom here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Not wind? it shall, it must; you see it doth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, but</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark how he bears his course, and runs me up</div>
                              <div class="line">With like advantage on the other side;</div>
                              <div class="line">Gelding the opposed continent as much</div>
                              <div class="line">As on the other side it takes from you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, but a little charge will trench him here</div>
                              <div class="line">And on this north side win this cape of land;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then he runs straight and even.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have it so: a little charge will do it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not have it alter'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">No, nor you shall not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Who shall say me nay?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that will I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me not understand you, then; speak it in Welsh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">I can speak English, lord, as well as you;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I was train'd up in the English court;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where, being but young, I framed to the harp</div>
                              <div class="line">Many an English ditty lovely well</div>
                              <div class="line">And gave the tongue a helpful ornament,</div>
                              <div class="line">A virtue that was never seen in you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am glad of it with all my heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather be a kitten and cry mew</div>
                              <div class="line">Than one of these same metre ballad-mongers;</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather hear a brazen canstick turn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or a dry wheel grate on the axle-tree;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that would set my teeth nothing on edge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing so much as mincing poetry:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis like the forced gait of a shuffling nag.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, you shall have Trent turn'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not care: I'll give thrice so much land</div>
                              <div class="line">To any well-deserving friend;</div>
                              <div class="line">But in the way of bargain, mark ye me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll cavil on the ninth part of a hair.</div>
                              <div class="line">Are the indentures drawn? shall we be gone?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">The moon shines fair; you may away by night:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll haste the writer and withal</div>
                              <div class="line">Break with your wives of your departure hence:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am afraid my daughter will run mad,</div>
                              <div class="line">So much she doteth on her Mortimer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit GLENDOWER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, cousin Percy! how you cross my father!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot choose: sometime he angers me</div>
                              <div class="line">With telling me of the mouldwarp and the ant,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the dreamer Merlin and his prophecies,</div>
                              <div class="line">And of a dragon and a finless fish,</div>
                              <div class="line">A clip-wing'd griffin and a moulten raven,</div>
                              <div class="line">A couching lion and a ramping cat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And such a deal of skimble-skamble stuff</div>
                              <div class="line">As puts me from my faith. I tell you what;</div>
                              <div class="line">He held me last night at least nine hours</div>
                              <div class="line">In reckoning up the several devils' names</div>
                              <div class="line">That were his lackeys: I cried 'hum,' and 'well, go to,'</div>
                              <div class="line">But mark'd him not a word. O, he is as tedious</div>
                              <div class="line">As a tired horse, a railing wife;</div>
                              <div class="line">Worse than a smoky house: I had rather live</div>
                              <div class="line">With cheese and garlic in a windmill, far,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than feed on cates and have him talk to me</div>
                              <div class="line">In any summer-house in Christendom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceedingly well read, and profited</div>
                              <div class="line">In strange concealments, valiant as a lion</div>
                              <div class="line">And as wondrous affable and as bountiful</div>
                              <div class="line">As mines of India. Shall I tell you, cousin?</div>
                              <div class="line">He holds your temper in a high respect</div>
                              <div class="line">And curbs himself even of his natural scope</div>
                              <div class="line">When you come 'cross his humour; faith, he does:</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant you, that man is not alive</div>
                              <div class="line">Might so have tempted him as you have done,</div>
                              <div class="line">Without the taste of danger and reproof:</div>
                              <div class="line">But do not use it oft, let me entreat you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EARL OF WORCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, my lord, you are too wilful-blame;</div>
                              <div class="line">And since your coming hither have done enough</div>
                              <div class="line">To put him quite beside his patience.</div>
                              <div class="line">You must needs learn, lord, to amend this fault:</div>
                              <div class="line">Though sometimes it show greatness, courage, blood,--</div>
                              <div class="line">And that's the dearest grace it renders you,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet oftentimes it doth present harsh rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Defect of manners, want of government,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pride, haughtiness, opinion and disdain:</div>
                              <div class="line">The least of which haunting a nobleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Loseth men's hearts and leaves behind a stain</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the beauty of all parts besides,</div>
                              <div class="line">Beguiling them of commendation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I am school'd: good manners be your speed!</div>
                              <div class="line">Here come our wives, and let us take our leave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter GLENDOWER with the ladies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the deadly spite that angers me;</div>
                              <div class="line">My wife can speak no English, I no Welsh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">My daughter weeps: she will not part with you;</div>
                              <div class="line">She'll be a soldier too, she'll to the wars.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good father, tell her that she and my aunt Percy</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall follow in your conduct speedily.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Glendower speaks to her in Welsh, and she
answers him in the same</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">She is desperate here; a peevish self-wind harlotry,</div>
                              <div class="line">one that no persuasion can do good upon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The lady speaks in Welsh</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">I understand thy looks: that pretty Welsh</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou pour'st down from these swelling heavens</div>
                              <div class="line">I am too perfect in; and, but for shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a parley should I answer thee.</div>
                              <p>The lady speaks again in Welsh</p>
                              <div class="line">I understand thy kisses and thou mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that's a feeling disputation:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will never be a truant, love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till I have learned thy language; for thy tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly penn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sung by a fair queen in a summer's bower,</div>
                              <div class="line">With ravishing division, to her lute.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, if you melt, then will she run mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The lady speaks again in Welsh</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">O, I am ignorance itself in this!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">She bids you on the wanton rushes lay you down</div>
                              <div class="line">And rest your gentle head upon her lap,</div>
                              <div class="line">And she will sing the song that pleaseth you</div>
                              <div class="line">And on your eyelids crown the god of sleep.</div>
                              <div class="line">Charming your blood with pleasing heaviness,</div>
                              <div class="line">Making such difference 'twixt wake and sleep</div>
                              <div class="line">As is the difference betwixt day and night</div>
                              <div class="line">The hour before the heavenly-harness'd team</div>
                              <div class="line">Begins his golden progress in the east.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">With all my heart I'll sit and hear her sing:</div>
                              <div class="line">By that time will our book, I think, be drawn</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLENDOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Do so;</div>
                              <div class="line">And those musicians that shall play to you</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang in the air a thousand leagues from hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">And straight they shall be here: sit, and attend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Kate, thou art perfect in lying down: come,</div>
                              <div class="line">quick, quick, that I may lay my head in thy lap.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, ye giddy goose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The music plays</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Now I perceive the devil understands Welsh;</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'tis no marvel he is so humorous.</div>
                              <div class="line">By'r lady, he is a good musician.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Then should you be nothing but musical for you are</div>
                              <div class="line">altogether governed by humours. Lie still, ye thief,</div>
                              <div class="line">and hear the lady sing in Welsh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather hear Lady, my brach, howl in Irish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY PERCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst thou have thy head broken?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HOTSPUR</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
